name: Takopa
text: Ate the takoyaki sampler with mentaiko mayo, nori shio (seaweed and salt) spicy, and original. Super yummy I think my all time favorite was the spicy it has small cubes of jalape√±os on top of some spicy mayo. I also ordered the grilled squid and of course they're karage (chicken). Really yummy for soft opening I believe they are coming out pretty strong. I believe there is always room for improvement I know making takoyaki isn't easy but that's what soft openings are for right? To get to perfection! I would defiantly recommend this place it's super close to Japanese street food for a restaurant in America! I'm super glad that when I'm missing these flavors there's a place I can go in and grab some good takoyaki not the frozen stuff

name: Takopa
text: This place is awesome !!! Food was great my favorite dish is yakisoba and ramen this place is bomb!!!! My new spot now

name: Takopa
text:
Tried this place on their soft opening. I like the food, but kinda long wait for our order.
A must try place to people who love takoyaki!
Also tried their ramen, not really great. So just stick to takoyaki and other their japanese street food. Almost forgot about their tornado potato.. i love it !

name: Takopa
text: Found an awesome takoyaki spot in china town. This place is super clean and friendly. The decor is kind of retro pop. The food is really good... I got the sampler, ikamaru and karage... I was not disappointed... and you can even watch them make it. I recommend this spot.

name: Takopa
text: This place is amazing! Got invited to the soft opening and it seemed as though they have been open for a week already. Service was excellent and all of the items we tried were slammin! Korobuta sausage is delicious and yakisoba noodles are to die for!!!!

name: Takopa
text:
My friends and I came to Takopa on their second day of soft opening. We were a bit lucky and snagged seats at the bar area. While sitting at the bar, you're able to see everything that the kitchen is doing. So if you're ever curious on whether or not they spit on your food....you won't have to be curious anymore!

We decided to share an order of their mentaiko takoyaki, original yakisoba, and an okonomiyaki. 

For their takoyaki, all of them are the same. The only difference is the sauce or topping they put on them. As we were sitting at the bar, we got to see how the takoyaki was made. The person making it probably was not used to it at all -- he was making them way too slow. Once he was done, he put all of them to the side grill while making more. Except a lot of them became quite deflated. 

Taste wise, it was decent with the sauce. But they did not serve the takoyaki fresh. Ours were sitting there for quite some time before they served it to us. I think he also cooked it too long that the octopus shrank too much. I can't say I was too impressed with this.

The yakisoba was pretty decent. The noodles were a really good texture. However, I think their sauce isn't quite as traditional? Their yakisoba sauce is missing something as it tastes different than what I'm used to.

Their okonomiyaki is thick and rectangular shaped versus the traditional circular shape. The flavor is pretty decent but I think they kind of overcooked this. They top it off with the same yakisoba sauce but they didn't put much sauce on it. Would have been better with more sauce so you could have a little bit of sauce on every bite. I think they did take our suggestion to heart and now there's more sauce!

Overall, pretty decent. Really fair pricing. However, it takes a while to get your food. And that just translates to ... if there's a wait, you'll be waiting for a while. I'd be willing to return if they could get the process of making takoyaki down :)

name: Takopa
text: This is a nice little joint staff is friendly and helpful.  As for the food I got the takoyaki sampler it had 4 pieces with different flavors not great I had better at other places.  The tuna belly skewer is blah don't get it not worth it.  The tako wasabi is good but really small portion.  And the last item I got was Japanese pancake very tasty I would recommend trying this. Overall the price isn't too bad just not a huge selection.

name: Takopa
text: Prices are great, nice layout great of the place, open window style to the kitchen, incredibly nice staff. Not bad, especially for a newer spot. Forewarning to those not well versed in cultural stuff, it's all street foods/sides style.

name: Takopa
text:
I like this place! We ordered the original takoyaki, 4 piece sampler, Japanese pancake, kimchi, and potato swirl. The takoyaki and the pancake were perfect! Nothing was overcooked and the veggies and seafood ratio was on point. I think my fave was the original, it is just a classic. One important point is to be careful of the inside of the takoyaki, it is super hot. 

I did not like the potato swirl. I am pretty sure it is supposed to be crunchy, but it was crunchy on the edges and soggy in the middle. I'd like it to be consistent in texture. The garlic flavor was good though!

Another problem was that we had to remind the waitress twice to get our kimchi. I was about to remind her a third time, but we made eye contact and she went immediately back into the kitchen to get the kimchi.

Overall, the food is good, but I guess they are still working out some minor details to get it just right!

name: Takopa
text:
-This is a soft opening review-

Soft openings are designed to practice and test out everything, therefore, this review is purely for soft opening period only

This is a new sister restaurant of Izakaya Go's, in main Chinatown, that serves Japanese street foods. Takopa is located in the middle, to the left of Mother's Korean BBQ, where it used to be an Asian DVD/CD store.

The size of Takopa is fairly decent, with an open style kitchen with large windows and 'bar seating" so you can see everything being made. 

The menu is fairly simple. 4 takoyaki's, 3 yakisoba's, okonomiyaki, ramen, a small list of finger foods, and desserts. 

I came here with a few friends and we had the choice of sitting at the foldable white table in front of the restaurant or at the bar. There was an open 6-person table but it was said to be reserved (later saw a party of like 10-12 bringing cases of alcohol for a celebration). 

We had sat at the bar on the far right with views of the entire kitchen, mainly the takoyaki maker and the flat top for okonomiyaki/yakisoba. 

The takoyaki base is all the same. With octopus, green onion, and red ginger but 4 different "styles" varying in toppings and sauces. Since that was the case, we had opt'ed for the "Mentaiko" takoyaki to try. We were watching the takoyaki's being made. The chef working the takoyaki station was super slow. I even saw him lower the heat to match the speed of how he prepared the takoyaki. After pouring the very thin batter into the maker, he adds the red ginger, green onions, 1 piece of octopus, some sort of brown powder, and some sort of white powder to the maker, before he starts to flip everything with chopsticks. Due to the lowered heat, the outside of the takoyaki doesn't get enough color or "crust" if you can call it that. In my mind, a takoyaki should have a nice brown outside, while the inside is piping hot, nice and creamy. 

The restaurant was "busy" but not completely packed. After one batch was "made", it was put off to the other side to wait for orders while a new batch is made. The new batch was done but for some reason, we were given the "older" batch, while we saw he also picked from the newer batch for another order. All takoyaki received, were quite deflated and not piping hot. Typically, fresh made takoyaki, you can not put it in your mouth without breathing fire. I threw the entire thing in my mouth and was fine. As mentioned before, the base for the takoyaki is same throughout the 4 styles. "Mentaiko" has a thin drizzle of the mentaiko mayo and a small pile of shredded seaweed. The flavor of the takoyaki itself seemed nice. Hope after this soft opening period, the maker will be much faster and using a higher heat to make the takoyaki's nice and brown, and not deflated. Just watching him make the takoyaki was depressing enough. 

"Okonomiyaki (Japanese Pan Cake) - pork, shrimp, squid, cabbage, green onion, red ginger, dried bonito, seaweed powder, egg, homemade sauce and mayo w/ additional toppings (at extra cost) of cheese, jalapeno, kimchi, shredded seaweed, mentai mayo, or ontama. 

This is one thing i haven't had in ages and was excited to try again. Seeing so many japan video's by many various bloggers, i've been wanting to have okonomiyaki for a while. Loaded with a mountain of cabbage mixed with pork, shrimp, squid and red ginger again. Awkwardly they make it a rectangular shape and not a traditional round shape, stating it was easier for the chef to prepare this way. It takes an unbelievably long time, probably due to the thickness, to make an order. The egg they put in the beginning is way overcooked. 

My friend and I were discussing how this could be improved. We do believe more sauce is needed. Especially on how thick the okonomiyaki is. We observed the kitchen staff to brush on the brown sauce while drizzling a thin string of the white. Personally, we believe more of both would be beneficial. Typically im not a sauce guy, but in this case, it may be better? Or maybe offer some on the side for people to put more if wanted. Flattening it out a bit and probably covering each one would help the cook times, and maybe cook the egg separately to put on top? 

"Original Yakisoba" w/ pork or chicken, cabbage, onion, green onion, red ginger, dried bonito, seaweed powder (option for a sunny side egg for additional cost). 

Last but not least, the yakisoba. Noodles cooked in hot water for a specific time before throwing on the flat top to cook with the other ingredients. Later I saw the chef to use 1 ladle amount. Maybe increase by 50%-100%? Flavor is ALMOST there. Though prefer the noodles to be a little less cooked as well. Overall, not bad. 

Discussed if hiroshima style okonomiyaki will be available and was told it is considered and may be implemented with future additions to menu

one major complaint though... WHY IS THERE GINGER IN EVERYTHING?! AND CAN WE OMIT IT?! (sad face) LOL

name: Takopa
text: Really intersting food.  The staff was helpful.   The octopus ball appetizers were really great.  I had the sampler. We also had the "Japanese Pancake" which is more like an omelet than a pancake but it is filled with all sorts of interesting things.  We also had some noodles.  The whole meal with appetizers was about $20.  I definitely want to sample some other items next time.

name: Takopa
text: We have been waiting for this spot to open. We've never had Japanese street food, and these foods are great. We had the 16 pc sample takoyaki, the grilled squid, deep fried octopus, potato tornado and the Japanese pancake. We're definitely coming back to try more and...that octopus is amazing, so we're coming back for that! Customer service is pretty good too.

name: Takopa
text:
Caveat: Japanese street food is probably my least favorite sub cuisine of Japan. 

That being said, this was a fun experience. I ordered three things to get a broad experience. The potato cut up on a stick was tasty and enjoyable. Definitely worth getting. The takoyaki sampler had one that I liked, two I was ok with, and one I wasn't so wild anout. The yakisoba is a bit of an acquired taste for me--smoke and salt were the dominant flavors that I tasted. Admittedly I'm not so sure I would be rushing to get it again but if those flavors work for you, then you're going to dig it.

Bonus points for an open kitchen. Really dug watching them prepare the food.

Thumbs up.

name: Takopa
text: I came to Takopa because we were invited to a limited guest invite-only soft opening. The theme is Japanese street food. Spending some considerable time in Japan, I was very excited and intrigued to try this place out. Much to my surprise, Takopa offers a dish called okonomiyaki, a pancake with pork and seafood. I can say without a doubt that one bite of this took me straight back to my days trolling the streets of Osaka munching on everything in site. Truly an exceptional taste. This place is highly recommended!

name: Takopa
text: It's delicious and inexpensive. The restaurant is cute, clean, and cozy. The staff is friendly and will check on you often. Everything was perfect.

name: Takopa
text:
Went to the recent grand opening. Can be kind of hard to find in the strip mall, but a gem in Chinatown. Authentic Japanese owned restaurant. Tried the yakisoba, takoyaki, and okonomiyaki. All reminded me of my vacation to japan - so fresh and delicious.

Highly recommended, and I will definitely be back the next time I visit Vegas.

name: Takopa
text:
Takopa is a new Japanese street food restaurant from the same owners as Izakaya Go and Pokeman. It's located in the middle of the large mall in China Town, right behind the giant gold statue. The inside is pretty small like the usual restaurants in the area. There's maybe around 5 tables and a bar style seating area as well. It definitely gets busy later in the night so be prepared for a possible wait. 

As for the food I tried a few different menu items. The tornado potato was good. It was super crispy and almost more like a fresh chip, I recommend adding garlic! The ikamaru was cooked perfectly and had just a bit of seasoning. A must try for any squid lovers. My all time favorite though was the tako wasabi. The flavor was unlike anything I had tried before, the wasabi was not super spicy at all and the octopus was very fresh & tasty. I didn't care as much for the takoyaki, but I think it's just a texture thing for me. I assumed they'd be a bit more crispy, but were kind of mushy.

Overall I really liked this place and would come back again to try more of the dishes. I'm glad to see another new concept from these owners.

name: Takopa
text: love the place from interior, cleanliness, friendliness, & food.  didn't know which one i wanted, so ordered the takopa sampler.  i still don't know which one i like best since they are all delicious.  looking forward to going back to try their other items on the menu.

name: Takopa
text:
Delicious food with nice decor in a shopping complex that could sorely use another great dining option, especially if you're someone like me who likes to graze for extended periods of time on small plates rather than chow down on one large entree. The prices can't be beat, either -- we ordered two small plates and the total cost came out to $10 with tax and tip.

The service left a little bit to be desired, and it's a bit awkward when entire meals are coming out to guests who came in after you while you're stuck there waiting for two appetizers, but Takopa is new, so I understand that it takes a little while to get your legs. Overall, I enjoyed my experience and will return soon. I'm really looking forward to what the future holds for this place.

name: Takopa
text: I love takoyaki so I was super excited when I found out that this place was opening. I've been here two times and the food is consistent. The flavors of the takoyaki are pretty good, my favorite is the spicy. I don't like the texture as much so maybe they can cook it longer because it's kinda mushy. It also doesn't have that crunch when you bight  into it. The best menu item here is the okonomiyaki. It's crunch and filled with seafood. Also, there's plenty of sauce on it like how it should be. Overall, I give 4 stars because I don't have to go to another restaurant just to have to takoyaki (where it's a side dish).

name: Takopa
text: Came here for lunch, ordered takoyaki sampler (16 pieces) with friends, all four flavors were good, I liked the "original" flavor the most.  Chicken Yakisoba was very tasty, a little bit on the sweet side.  Okonomiyaki was the best in town! Texture was perfect and the sauce was very tasty.  The restaurant was simple and cute.  Really loved the open kitchen design.  We saw our orders being made.  Waitress was kind of slow and not certain about some items, but pretty friendly.  I love the fact that it's in Chinatown Plaza, which has ample parking and many other stores to go to.  Will definitely return to try other items!

name: Takopa
text: Cool new spot in Chinatown. The food reminds me of Japan. Both Takoyaki and Okonomiyaki had the right texture, nice and soft on the inside. The servers were very knowledgeable, was told it takes time for dishes to come out cuz they make it by the order which was fine, rather wait for good food. Have to go back for their yakisoba and other side dishes.

name: Takopa
text: We got the big sampler of takoyaki, the pancake, and seafood yakitori.  Now considering this place is from izakaya go I expected the takoyaki to be a lot better. Don't get me wrong they were still good here, but they are so much better at izakaya go.  Next the pancake, my favorite thing today.  We didn't add anything to it, the bacon was crispy as well as the exterior, egg was not overly cooked and just really hit the spot.  The seafood yakitori was great also. Seafood wasn't over cooked and there was more than I expected for the price.  Will be back.

name: Takopa
text:
I really wanted the takoyaki to be good here. I really did, but I'm not going to lie and say it was good, but I know it has potential to be good. I'm only criticizing, because I care. I love Pokeman and Izakaya Go, so I really want this place to succeed as well. I know this place just opened, but if you're going to have a takoyaki-centered restaurant, I would really hope you're going to perfect your takoyaki recipe before opening-up shop.

My friend and I ordered the original and mentaiko takoyaki. Both of the actual takoyaki just tasted flavorless and uninspired. The toppings could only do so much and I had to heavily rely on the pickled ginger to enhance the taste of the dishes. Very much not a good sign. 

The dish that I actually enjoyed was the okonomiyaki. It almost tasted like the ones I had in Japan. However, there is room for improvement. 

I really hope they improve on their takoyaki. It's one of my favorite Japanese street foods, and it would be a bummer if they don't elevate their standards on their main dish.

name: Takopa
text:
Now it's My favorite Takoyaki place in Las Vegas.

I tried Original.
their Takoyaki was soft one which is common in west side of Japan. It might not common in US to feel like almost raw inside. But actually, it's common in Osaka.
I prefer harder outside one like "Gindako" in Tokyo personally though.
But the taste of their Takoyaki was really good.

It came with 6 counts. I don't know it's been like that or not. cuz I saw the picture with 8 counts on Yelp too...

And the stuff was really nice.

name: Takopa
text: Customer service was good and I enjoyed sitting at the bar area, watching the takoyakis being made. I wasn't a big fan of the taste of the takoyaki (original) and regular okinomiyaki. I'm no connoisseur by any means so I honestly have nothing to compare it to. Their ramen was alright.

name: Takopa
text: It's pretty good!  Staff are attentive too. Try sitting at the counter to see things in action.

name: Takopa
text: Great pricing with a great environment! Good takoyaki for 5 bucks, and crispy garlic tornado potatoes for 3 dollars. Worth!

name: Takopa
text: I can't believe how good this food is! And it says small plates, but the portions are big especially for the price. Maybe it's just because of the grand opening but I really hope it stays consistent. Everything we ordered was amazing and had us oohing and ahhhing, and offering bites to each other because we are amazed at how good it is. We'll definitely be back often.

name: Takopa
text:
I've been waiting for the store to open for forever now and I was not disappointed when I went to their opening! They had a soft opening the week before but I wasn't able to to go! Though when I was finally able to visit I was very much satisfied and would definitely go again! 
 I ordered their karaage, original takoyaki and the tornado potato with cheese! The food was amazing and they looked very presentable and tasty! The chicken was so tender yet crispy! Usually I like to add sauce usually for karaages but theirs you really don't need to! 
 I totally recommend this place to anyone looking for some good Japanese street food! It's also facinating to watch them cook your food and prepare it! The staff was very friendly and accommodating! 
 The price is very worth it too! 
Again most definitely will come back again and will totally be recommending it to anyone!

name: Takopa
text:
Finally this place is open!!!! 
The menu is pretty simple which is great! 

We ordered:

*Takopa sampler-love it! You get to try all types of takoyaki if you're indecisive. 
*Okonomiyaki-ordered it with kimchi! It tastes like a giant version of a takoyaki lol. MUST order this!
*Takowasabi-I've always liked this. Its nothing different w/ the other takowasabi. 
*Yakisoba-ordered it w/Chicken but I think with just veggies is already good enough! 
*Potato Tornado-its okay. Its just a regular potato w/ seasoning lol

Will be coming back here again. Hopefully they will have their alcohol licensed by then! :)

name: Takopa
text:
I like the concept of a takoyaki spot, which also serves some favorite Japanese snacks. But, maybe takoyaki in this case should be left for street vendors in Japan. 

We tried the 16-piece sampler, which included the original, mentaiko, spicy, and negi shio. Unfortunately, none of them really stood out too much and we all felt that the batter was undercooked. Both the seafood and original yakisoba were too salty for my liking. The sauce was not good. The okonomiyaki and ramen were average at best. I was also disappointed by how the potato tornado was overfried. It tasted exactly like potato chips on a stick and were brittle and broke right off instead of being crispy on the edges and slightly softer on the inside from the ones I've tried at night markets and street vendors. 

The only dish that I thought was done well was the karaage, which was well-fried and tender on the inside. Hopefully things improve after the soft opening. I do like the open view of the kitchen and the preparation of the takoyaki. The pries are fair, but not worth a visit unless quality improves.

name: Takopa
text:
I was just so disappointed upon leaving this restaurant. The food quality was just so bad. I ordered just about everything off the menu: 16 pc takoyaki, chicken yakisoba, okonomiyaki, kurubota sausage, and a garlic potato tornado. The takoyaki was probably the most disappointing item on the menu as it was all mush on the inside. I was really mainly looking for a spot that served takoyaki and I was VERY disappointed.. The yakisoba on the other hand had a very odd sweet flavor to it while the noodles leaving a burnt after taste. The okonomiyaki was the most normal dish out of my order and was mediocre at best although some sauce tuning on the mentaiko should be made to attune to the dish better. The kurobuta sausage was also very bland and kind of resembled a semi fancier vienna sausage even though I personally believe even a vienna sausage would taste better. The garlic potato tornado chip was good. 

Lastly, I know and understand that this restaurant is still in their grand opening phase, etc. but I'm sure they'll continue to modify their menu and dishes. Until then, my review will stay. I honestly don't ever make any reviews but this was the only restaurant as a foodie that made me want to leave a review as customer service as well didn't ask if the food was okay after we left everything uneaten/untouched.

name: Takopa
text: Delicious new spot in Chinatown Plaza. Great renditions of Japanese street food. Perfect if you just want a snack and a glass of Sapporro, or, if you are looking for something more substantial, they offer 3 different bowls of ramen, along with yakisoba. I'm already a fan of Izakaya Go and Pokeman. I'm adding this to the list.

name: Takopa
text: Second time here and it's getting better. Their Red Ginger condiment has just the right amount of salt and acid. Chashu and rice was yummy. Karaage was good. Negi shio takoyaki was mushy; nice presentation though. Service was better this time around as there was less people than the past time. We will be back.

name: Takopa
text:
From the owners of Pokeman and Izakaya Go.. Hi Takopa! 
A great idea that will definitely be successful, but disappointing if you've had takoyaki before. Quick, easy food that's meant to be enjoyed with some beerzz. We tried the 4 flavor takoyaki sampler. Honestly, all tasted the same and nothing stood out. Yakisoba was salty and nothing like what it should taste like. Huge portion. 
The okonomiyaki will probably be their least ordered on the menu, but was by far the best thing we had. I've never had okonomiyaki with so many different things in it, but it worked. American style! 
Popping plaza with lots of other places to go to for dessert, more food, boba, etc.

name: Takopa
text:
This place toooooooooooooooooooooooo oooooooooooooooooooooooo oooooooooooooooooooooooo oooooooooooooooooooooooo oooooooooooooooooooooooo oooooooooooooooooooooooo
Firea must try !

name: Takopa
text: Came here after a friend of mine recommended it. She said the prices were great for the food you get and I have to agree. The food was very good at a great price. I ordered the karaage and the Takopa special of 4 pieces of each takoyaki type they have to offer. The service was fairly quick and the food was presented nicely. Would recommend!

name: Takopa
text: My friends and I were waiting for this place to open and we finally got to try it. The first thing I noticed when I walked in was the smell of the restaurant. It smelled like a sewage area. Customer service wise was pretty good; everyone was really friendly. We ordered the original yakisoba, 16 takoyaki sampler, okonomiyaki, and karaage. The 16 takoyaki sampler was fun to taste. I like the original and spicy takoyaki the most. One of them has too much mayonnaise and that was my least favorite. The okonomiyaki wasn't that much special. The yakisoba was good! I just wish there was more noodle. Food tasted decent for its price. However, I don't think I'll be back for awhile unless they get that smell fix. If you like tapas, this would be a decent place to give it a try.

name: Takopa
text: delicious food,and im recommend this place

name: Takopa
text:
Takopa is a small izakaya-style spot specializing in takoyaki, from the same owners as PokeMan and Izakaya Go. Popped in for late night solo dining at the bar and got to watch the food get made in the open kitchen. Love the octopus tentacle decor around the dining room!

I tried the takoyaki sampler to get a feel for their namesake dish, as well as the chashu bowl and a tornado potato. I don't claim to be any huge fan of takoyaki, but I liked the option to try each of their four featured styles- spicy, mentaiko, negi shio, and original. I preferred the negi but found that the balls were oddly inconsistent with the texture/cook despite watching the chef make them all in one large batch. The bowl was a good value but served far too salty for my liking, while the tornado potato was just right: crispy edges, soft interior, light sprinkle of garlic.  Pricing and portions are fair, my meal was under $15 with tax and tip.

Service was a bit disorganized- friendly but frazzled, but perhaps they are still finding their footing. Don't forget to check out the specials board, by the hostess stand.

name: Takopa
text:
Price is pretty good and food is very filling! 
We came in for just a little snack but ended up ordering more because everything looked so good.
Get seats by the bar if you can so you can see all the magic happening.
Potato tornado with Garlic seasoning- Crisp light taste. I plan on ordering every time from now on.
Tapoyaki x2- You don't see these everywhere so this was really exciting. Hot off the pan and no matter how you get it, it's amazing.
Japanese pancake- big enough for two to share or just one person meal. Wonderful mixture of cabbage, shrimp, egg, just a party of flavors in your mouth.
Best part all four items only $24.00
Happy stomach and piggy bank!

name: Takopa
text:
I actually had a great time and enjoyed having dinner here. From the outside, I really didn't know what to expect, and once I walked in.. I still didn't know what to expect lol. Awesome setup as the kitchen has a glass window so people can see how things are made.. there's also a bar style seating area so you can eat and watch what the chefs are doing.. creeper! jk lol.. or choose to sit on a table with a bench style seating along the wall. I really appreciated that they had cushion for me to sit on that wooden bench seat. Lots of cool and interesting wall art, although I'm starting to see a common trend with Japanese restaurants here that kind of have the same general wall art.. but it's cool for now. 

Servers were really nice and explained what we needed to know and always being very tentative when we needed something.. 

I ordered an original takoyaki.. an okonomiyaki.. original yakisoba.. chicken karaage.. spicy chashu bowl.. and the tako wasabi.. just a little hungry lol..

Everything was soo good!! The okonomiyaki is huge  so be prepared for that.. the spicy chashu bowl wasn't spicy but very tasty!! And the tako wasabi was awesome.. just wished it had more!! 

Also ordered a Sapporo beer as it is just a perfect match for this dinner..

Food was great and I can't wait to try out everything else on the menu!

Enjoy!!

name: Takopa
text:
So.. I had high hopes for this place but they let me down. A friend recommended I try it since it was 20% off today. I got the original and spicy takoyaki- both were fine. The spicy was not spicy at all which was a bummer. I also got the okonomiyaki which was full of veggies and a decent portion size. Don't waste your time on the karrage though. It was lacking flavor and served with salt.. which I though was odd and a first for me. I'm not a fan of places that MAKE you season your food on your own. Lastly, the ramen (which probably wouldn't have gotten to our table if I didn't ask them about it) was underwhelming. I normally don't get shoyu but I thought I'd give it a try. No flavor at all! I actually had to use the salt that was meant for the chicken. The noodles were too al dente (probably cause they were in a hurry to get it out to me) and the chashu had a weird flavor that was almost too unpleasant to eat. 
Maybe I'll give it another try later down the road but for now, I'll pass.

name: Takopa
text: Okonomiyaki was delicious and a great value. That alone would have satisfied me but I also got the Yakisoba. Equally delicious. I'm very happy someone finally brought Japanese street food to Vegas. It's a refreshing addition to Chinatown.

name: Takopa
text: The takoyaki here is probably the best I've ever eaten in Vegas. Though the prices are cheap, the amount shown on the menu and the amount on the plate are different; the portions served are much smaller. It took approximately 20 minutes for the food to come out.

name: Takopa
text: The anticipation for Takopa's opening was real. I absolutely love the concept of the restaurant. The menu items are primarily small bites, but there's also the option of different yakisoba and ramen. Due to the fact that the prices are reasonable and a majority of the food choices are tapas, it's easy to try a variety of items. From the finger foods category, we ordered the tornado potato (fried potatoes on a skewer). We opted to go with a garlic powder topping. My boyfriend and I both ordered a different type of takoyaki - he ordered the mentaiko (spicy cod roe) and I ordered the spicy. The mentaiko is definitely not for someone who doesn't like "fishier" tastes; however, we really enjoyed both. There's a large glass window that wraps around the restaurant and you can watch the chefs freshly make the takoyaki! Super cool. The last thing we ordered was the okonomiyaki - a Japanese pan cake. It's customizable so we removed the pork and added kim chi. They do make you aware upon ordering that it takes about 20 minutes for the takoyaki and okonomiyaki to come out. The servers were very sweet and attentive. We'll definitely come back!

name: Takopa
text: Food is okay. Not bad but not special either. I ordered togo for ramen. I came home to find that they never put any chashu with my order and the broth was so little I had to add water myself so that the noodles wouldn't absorb all of it. Really horrible to come home to a half done order and pay full price. Thanks

name: Takopa
text: Awesome food and awesome service. Workers were polite and friendly. Awesome view of the kitchen at the bar area. Very clean, up kept appearance inside. We had the Okonomiyaki, the 4 piece sampler of takoyaki, and an order of original takoyaki. Food was incredible. Will definitely come back next time I'm in town.

name: Takopa
text: Coming from Southern California, it's always hard for me and my family to look for a really good asian place to eat to par with where we eat in Cali. But this place is really good. The ramen isn't the best but the takoyaki is delicious. My family and I got the Original and the Negi Shio. The original is more salty than the Negi Shio, they both taste great but comparing the two we like the Negi Shio more. The reason for the four star is the ramen, it's not the best but it's good. The pork chasu is really good but overall it's decent.

name: Takopa
text: A restaurant dedicated to Japanese street food. I absolutely love Takoyaki and Oknomiyaki. We were greeted when we arrived and placed at a small table. We decided to order the Takoyaki Sampler, Kaarage, Oknomiyaki and the Potato Tornado. I wasn't exactly pleased with the potato tornado. It was ok but that's it. The karaage was fresh and fried correctly! It was a little bit too big for my taste. I prefer mine a little but smaller versus having to bite into the chicken. The Takoyaki Sampler had four different types of takoyaki. Honestly they were all the same except the sauces on top. Some of them were deflated and the batter in the middle was undercooked so it came out a bit too watery when I bit into it. The Oknomiyaki was good! It was huge and fresh. I think that was the only thing I enjoyed. It's a cute place and I'm glad I tried it out! I think I'll try it again if they add more items to your menu.

name: Pop Drinks
text:
POP was just what I needed on the first 3 digit day in Vegas yesterday! Situated in the corner of a large strip mall on Fort Apache, I was across the street for a lash appointment and decided to make a pit stop at Hobby Lobby. Felt parched and walked into Pop thinking it was a bubble tea joint, nope definitely not that - as the name implies it's pop for my midwesterners. Not just any old pop, speciality drinks made with pop. 

Such a simple concept honestly, but very well thought out and executed. I'm not much of a pop drinker, after all I counsel against it. But every once in a while I'll give myself the option, luckily it's not something I crave. Initially it was the feeling that I had walked into the place assuming it was something else but felt odd walking out. I got to looking at the menu and looking back outside at the sun beaming down and thought I'd give it a whirl. Have to say, I will be back!

Soda is used as a base ingredient to craft a drink. So if you create your own you choose a size, pick your soda (or tea for my healthies), pick your add ins. I appreciate that they have an XS size which for me was truly a S. Great for portion control people! Then they have a menu with fool proof recipes created for us. I chose the Jojo because I enjoy Dr. Pepper and substituted the coconut cream for vanilla cream. Yum! They also have a secret menu (see picture - white) of drink creations and needless to say I was overwhelmed with options. Finally, they have a foods fo pair alongside your beverages, popcorn and cookies. A kids menu per say - an XXS drink (12 oz) with kid size popcorn. Also, got beverages, coffee/hot chocolate. 

Aside from my beverage being delicious, I appreciated the service. It's a very simple concept so to speak, so the fact that the employee took his time to talk me through the menu was above and beyond. The pricing was right! The shop has ample seating, parking. You get a stamp card for return visits. I wasn't told explicitly about a guarantee but I'm sure my drink would've been remade had I not liked it. 

I was told they have another location, Silverado Ranch. Will most definitely be going back and recommending on a hot, hot day!

name: Pop Drinks
text: I usually love coming to Pop, but today (5/8 at 7PM) the two girls that were there were rude and had an attitude when we were literally their only customers. I've come in before when they were on shift and it's repeatedly been bad customer service. Wishing I had had the dude and the other girl that we usually see because they're always so bubbly and always asking us about our day and giving us suggestions for what to get. The only reason I gave 3 stars is because of those other two and the great drink specials.

name: Pop Drinks
text: I love this place! Incredibly delicious soda mixes and cookies that will blow your mind! I was treated super well by the staff working and will definitely frequent this place more often!

name: Pop Drinks
text: I was so excited to find Pop Drinks!! Their "Palms" soda is just what I need for a long day, coupled with a chilled sugar cookie and it's a heavenly treat! I love that I can get my kids a popcorn instead of a cookie when they have earned a treat but I don't want to give them sugar. We love it here!!

name: Pop Drinks
text: Caffeine is something the average American consumes everyday; my friend once said the most famous quote for a college student would be "one cup of coffee, just to keep me awake." This place defines caffeine in a more enjoyable and affordable way. I tried The Jojo on their pop favorites menu and it was a different way of drinking Dr. Pepper that made it feel like a brand new pop.

name: Pop Drinks
text:
What's with the sudden surge of soda spots opening up shop?! Say that five times fast. ;)
I rarely drink soda, so I am not even remotely in Pop's target audience. But I can appreciate their refreshing beverages when the temps hit triple digits in the desert!

The Oasis was my first drink of choice, which was fruity and not overly sweet despite the Sprite base. Though their drink menu is a bit smaller than other places around town, I really like how they have multiple options that are not soda-based, like the Flamingo and the High Roller (made with lemonade).  If you need a snack to go with your sips, Pop features sugar cookies for sweet and popcorn for salty.

name: Pop Drinks
text: Vegas finally has its own soda shop !! Pebble Ice , foam cups, and drive-up service! Don't miss out on the cookies !

name: Pop Drinks
text: Super cute, great place to go with your kids, the cookies (peanut butter especially) were amazing. I'll definitely be back!

name: Pop Drinks
text:
I really came here just to try the cookies...

The service is great -- all the staff are very friendly. 

You can get the cookies chilled or room temperature. I got the room temperature chocolate chip and sugar cookies. The sugar cookie was good. The icing is sweet and not too heavy. The cookie is a tiny bit floury, but I enjoyed it. The chocolate chip cookie is not like any other I have had. I'm not even sure that they use brown sugar. It tasted more like a sugar cookie, but it was great. I enjoyed it. I wish they used that base with mini m&m's instead of chocolate chips. My chocolate loving companion felt the cookie needed more chips. 

For a soda fountain like concept, I appreciate all the soda options they have (particularly, the diet options, since I don't drink regular). I wish they had some handcrafted or local options. Otherwise, I can get most of the options elsewhere.

Overall, a cute place that would be great for kids.

name: Pop Drinks
text: Finally a custom drink place in Las Vegas. This place is THE BEST! I was so excited to see huge styrofoam cups. Hallelujah! We all got different drinks and they we ALL amazing! The sugar free options are fantastic! The popcorn taste exactly like the popcorn at Disneyland. It is soo good...we even took home extra for our movie night. The cookies are especially delicious. Love the option of chilled or room temp. PB w/ chocolate frosting is a favorite!! The shop is clean, modern with a fun decor. The staff and owners greeted us with samples and were super friendly and accommodating. Prices are unbeatable. Oh and the drive-up parking spots so you don't have to get out of car are genius! We are looking forward to our daily "Pop-Stops" during the summer! THANK YOU POP!!

name: Pop Drinks
text:
Place was packed and loved how they have a drive up parking and take your order so you don't have to get out of your car from this heat. I'm not a soda person but tried their Jojo
And it was pretty good!! Got the rebel for my son and it came with a drink and popcorn. Got myself a chocolate chip cookie and that was soft and yummy!! This is the place you want to go if you want to snack on something simple.

name: Pop Drinks

stars with my experienced for the following reason

text: I've been to this cool shop a few times and every single time is amazing! I always get the Palms drink with either a sugar or peanut butter cookie. The cookies are SOOOO delicious, definitely the best I've ever had! Everyone working there is nice and the drive-up is really convenient. Even though it's not close to home, the drive is definitely worth it.

name: Pop Drinks
text:
SWIG MEETS LAS VEGAS!!!

I am so excited to see traditional soda fountain-type establishments coming to the Las Vegas Valley. Pops, like Splash (in Fabulous Freddy's on Grand Montecito), provides customers with customized sodas. For example, you can order a Diet Coke with coconut creamer and freshly squeezed limes or a Root Beer with cream and vanilla. They also sell cookies--the frosting on the snickerdoodles is amazing!

The prices are right and the employees are kind and helpful. In fact, when I ordered the wrong drink, they replaced it with what I really wanted without complaint or cost. This is great customer service and I will definitely go back!

Best of all (like Splash), they have a "drive-through." You drive to one of the designate spaces and an employee comes to your car to take and then deliver your order to your car. It feels a bit like an old-time Sonic (roller skates not included).

name: Pop Drinks
text: So many cool flavors and combinations. Cookies are amazing. All the drinks hit the spot. Plus it has great hours!

name: Pop Drinks
text: Just had my first experience at Pop. Cool place to get a tasty refreshment and snack. This place will be a top stop in the area. Met the owner and he was awesome. Definitely recommend.

name: Pop Drinks
text: I really love this place. The drinks are inexpensive and HUGE. I stop by whenever I'm at Hobby Lobby and the service is always fast and friendly. I usually get Sprite with a shot of guava or root beer with a shot of butterscotch.

name: Pop Drinks

name: Pop Drinks
text: Another soda shop hits Vegas! As a frequent Utah visitor, I have to say I like it! For those who didn't know, soda shops in Utah are like Starbucks and McDonald's in Vegas, they're everywhere! They're super fun and cute and usually have good treats so I knew I had to give this one a try. The location is a little awkward, kinda hard to find. The inside is really cute and modern. First thing, recognize now you're not going for the service. It's basically just a bunch of high school teenagers goofing around behind the counter so don't expect incredible customer service. Second, it's literally just every kind of soda there is and you can mix them together, nothing innovative here. You're not going to find any new incredible homemade soda or shake, just combinations of normal sodas. On the same note, they're pretty good! It's fun to try and is pretty tasty, I opted for the red rock. But now let's move onto the grand slam, the cookies. In Utah there's a very famous soda shop called Swig, that has these pink sugar cookies that are world famous. This place basically has replica swig cookies. They're super soft and served cold. They're jam packed with at least 5 cups of sugar and the most amazing frosting. They're the best. Overall, it's a soda shop with 17 year olds running it. It's cute, the sodas are good, the cookies are good, and it's a fun time. Just know what to expect before you get there!

name: Pop Drinks
text: Just went to a soft opening with the youth from our church. I have waited a long time for a fun soda place to open in Las Vegas. The owners were so friendly and treated us like family. The cookies and soda combinations were delicious! And the nugget ice is spot on. I know it's a random thing, but the ice is delicious! I will be here often. Especially in the hot summer months.

name: Pop Drinks
text: Their cookies are literally the best thing ever!!  Obsessed with their sodas and popcorn. The owners are so nice and welcoming

name: Pop Drinks
text: We noticed a bright pink neon sign that said pop on it on our usual journey to hobby lobby and I'm so glad we checked it out. They have so many delicious specialty soda options like for example a butter beer from Harry Potter and on top of that they have, popcorn, and desserts. All at a reasonable price. On top of that, the service was so friendly especially since it was our first time. The cashier had no problem telling us what was popular and helping us out. I highly recommend checking it out if you get a chance!

name: Pop Drinks
text: Got the Jojo & the flamingo. The drinks taste like the creme that's put into it with the carbonation of the soda. Both were good and the prices are super affordable for what you get. 44 oz for $3.75? YES! The service was extremely great. Workers were so nice & the drinks were finished with barely a wait!

name: Pop Drinks
text:
I've lived in Vegas for the past three years and I don't know why it's taken me so long to give this place a try! I'm not a big fan of soda, but the positive reviews on this place caught my attention. I'm very impressed with the idea of the mixture of soda/juice and other flavors because it's actually pretty good! 

You can either choose drinks from their menu or create your own. I loved the flamingo! Perfect blend of pink lemonade, raspberry puree, and vanilla cream. Definitely not overpriced too!

Not only do they sell drinks, but cookies and popcorn are offered. You can also add in powder flavor to the popcorn.

name: Pop Drinks
text: My daughter & I were leaving Hobby Lobby and we noticed this place on the corner and decided to check it out. Of course I checked Yelp first! I saw drinks, popcorn and cookies which sounded perfect! We walked in and were greeted by a nice guy and he was very helpful when I asked him about the menu and he also gave his suggestions which helped me decide on which drink to get. Basically it's custom flavored sodas. There was a menu on the wall with customer favorites and then at the counter they had a secret menu with a lot more to choose from and if you want you can create your own! I went with the Jojo which was Dr Pepper with raspberry puree and coconut cream. It was yummy! My daughter didn't want a drink but had popcorn with extra butter and a frosted sugar cookie which was soooo good! They had a few other cookies to choose from and I wish I had gotten one! Next time for sure! The inside was very clean and had a cute pink neon light sign. There was a bar seating along the wall, a few tables as well as a couch. There was also a TV. We also noticed that they have designated parking outside and they go out and take your order! The guys in there were really nice and will definitely be back to try some more drinks and cookies!

name: Pop Drinks
text: Finally a custom drink place in Las Vegas. This place is THE BEST! I was so excited to see huge styrofoam cups. Hallelujah! We all got different drinks and they we ALL amazing! The sugar free options are fantastic! The popcorn taste exactly like the popcorn at Disneyland. It is soo good...we even took home extra for our movie night. The cookies are especially delicious. Love the option of chilled or room temp. PB w/ chocolate frosting is a favorite!! The shop is clean, modern with a fun decor. The staff and owners greeted us with samples and were super friendly and accommodating. Prices are unbeatable. Oh and the drive-up parking spots so you don't have to get out of car are genius! name: Pop Drinks
text: This is a great place to get a drink with a twist and cookies to die for. The place is clean and fresh.

name: Pop Drinks
text:
A fun spot for some delicious drinks and treats! I saw this spot on Yelp and couldn't wait to give it a try. I don't usually drink pop (yes, I'm from the Midwest), but it looked too fun to pass on.

The inside of the shop is cute with bright colors. Pop is the main item offered. There are suggested combinations, similar to unique cocktails, but you can also create your own combination. It isn't just pop either, there are a few teas as well. Create your own combination using pop, flavor shots, creams, and purees. Popcorn and cookies are also offered.

The "Pop Favorites" had so many good combinations that my husband and I chose from that list. My husband loved The Rebel which combined fruit and energy drink. My Oasis was a great combination of Sprite, fruit, and coconut cream. The pink frosted cookie was a nice treat for us to share and delicious.

name: Pop Drinks
text: I wish I was given more stars, and I would give them all to Pop. lol Seriously. It was exactly what I was needing to fight this 110 degree heat. Let me first start by saying I walked in and had no clue what I was getting into. I had no idea what I was going to order, how to order or anything. I know I am from Illinois and up there soda is POP so to get a POP again was way cool!!!! I would have just gotten a Pepsi to just order a Pop and have them know what I was talking about. Anyway, I am off path, flavors to rival Willy Wonka. Seriously. Willy Wonka would be Lime Green Jelly at the flavors going on at Pop Drinks. I finally decided on a JoJo. IT was "Momentary" as in I needed a moment to gather myself and be able to form words as the refreshment and deliciousness took over my body. Thought maybe I had hearts shooting out of my eyes like the wolf in the cartoons. It was THAT GOOD. My son got a watermelon Mountain Dew which was refreshing on top of refreshment which he called the MT. EverRest, because it was so RESTful. lol so very punny. We had a lot of fun. It made my whole week. Thank you for bringing some joy to my family. I really appreciate it. I will sing your praises and share you all to all my friends.

name: Pop Drinks
text:
Soda places seems to be really in right now on this side of town, pop drinks is my go to spot for a quick fix! 

I normally get the oasis or the flamingo one with chilled sugar cookie ( you can get room temperature too) or when they have the brownie cookie that one is def a must!!

It's a cute little place, I'm normally in and out of the place but i always see kids playing games in their which look really fun and cozy. It has great atmosphere & great employees.

name: Pop Drinks

name: Pop Drinks

They have literally every flavor you could ever think of & some you wouldn't! & Not to mention the cookies!!! Only negative was how far it is. But that definitely won't stop me from making this a weekly thing it's 100% worth the drive!

name: Pop Drinks

name: Pop Drinks
text: Finally a great soda shop in Las Vegas. Great popcorn, awesome cookies and whatever soda combination you can come up with. You can even try a few combos before you decide what's your favorite.

name: Pop Drinks
text: Brought my son to POP for the first time and he loved it! Simple concept, affordable, and a delicious snack! I would definitely recommend to other families

name: Pop Drinks
text:
Pop has become a favorite of mine for spur of the moment treats!
I have visited a handful of times and have enjoyed my pop each time. 
I appreciate that it is a drive thru and I can be there and gone within minutes.
There is always a friendly voice on the other end of the drive through speaker that is happy to suggest something tasty. 
Butterbeer is my favorite pop thus far... as well as the iced sugar cookies. I'm sure I'll visit again soon, and look forward to trying other treats. 
The menu has hundreds of possibilities I'm sure! With several soda flavors, several syrups, and other fun add ins. As well as energy drinks and teas that can be customized to your liking.
On occasion of I have driven through on a weekend evening I have also noticed a food truck that will stop by and open up shop. 
I have also noticed that there are specials on certain days of the week, I use Instagram stories to keep up.
It's definitely worth a try to POP on over:)

name: Pop Drinks

name: Pop Drinks
text: I don't usually write reviews, but I felt like the worker deserved some recognition today! I believe his name was Noah. I brought my kids in for popcorn and a drink after our Hobby Lobby trip & he was so friendly! It's nice to see a teenager who actually values his job! Great job!! :)

name: Pop Drinks
text: Everybody needs to try the Jojo except instead of Dr. Pepper I got Pepsi. Also the sugar cookie is a delight. Ask for it chilled. I had to come back again the next day to try the flamingo and it was so savory and delectable. Perfect drink to imbibe on, on a hot summer day. Also the staff and owner Gina are very benevolent and attentive

name: Pop Drinks
text: DELICIOUS COOKIES!! I had the Snickerdoodle and the Oatmeal Chocolate chip. Beyond good. The cookies are large and chewy. If you are familiar with Swig in St. George, this is a similar concept. They have customizable pop (soda). They also have popcorn and customizable hot chocolate! I'm so excited to have this in Vegas.

name: Pop Drinks
text: The tea was fine, nothing to write home about, but the popcorn was cold, dry, and stale. Also, my drink came in styrofoam, which bums me out. Why not use something more earth-friendly?

name: Pop Drinks
text: Super yummy sodas, great prices and you can drive up for car side service! Which is awesome with littles in the car

name: Pop Drinks
text:
Fun concept, attentive staff. Drinks were whatever, didn't know that there was a menu that wasn't on the wall so I missed out on some of the special drinks they had. 
Cute decor, good vibe, I'd go back.

name: Pop Drinks
text: I have been here almost 3 days in a row now.. This place is really good. Simple concept but who would have thought just popcorn, cookies and drinks would be this big of a hit! name: Pop Drinks
