text: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! Seriously I went in on a Saturday afternoon and I'm obsessed. Its so yummy and fun! Definitely a new regular spot for me.

name: Pop Drinks
text: Stopped in here on Friday after some running around. It was about 110 outside and we were looking for some refreshment.  What a wonderful selection. I could go back every day for all summer and not get the same drink twice. ( We did go back on Saturday and introduced some friends to the selections). Don't get me started on the cookies. There's a little bit of heaven right there!  I will definitely be visiting this place every time I'm in town. Thanks for a great experience!

name: Pop Drinks
text: I love this cute little place. Their sugar cookies are the bomb. The snickerdoodles and coconut are my favorites. I love how they have so many options on their drink pops. I tried the Jojo little on the sweet side. Dr. Pepper with raspberry pur√©e and coconut cream. My go to will probably be the strawberry shortcake or strawberry cupcake. It's delicious a little less sweet made with sprite. I'm so glad it's down street from my house. Anytime I have a sweet tooth that's my go to!  Btw it's nice they have a drive up service that's awesome.

name: Pop Drinks
text: Came here out of curiosity and so glad we did! If you love a good root beer float, I would definitely recommend the Brown Cow!! Tastes just like an A&W root beer from the tap! And the chilled pink sugar cookies are on point will definitely be back to try more combos!

name: Pop Drinks
text: Obsessed!!! Super yummy and cute decor I love their coke and coconut cream, my family loved the guzzler and the rebel specialty drinks!

name: Pop Drinks
text: What a GREAT experience! Custom soft drinks were delicious! Must try! And the owners are super welcoming and friendly!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: Stopped in Cleaver for a celebratory dinner. I was impressed by the service the sexy dark atmosphere the interior and the style and swag that they have. They continued it on a more upscale level from that of Herbs & Rye. The music was banging and more importantly the food was a A-1. Started with a caesar salad with parmesan Toule crisp, very delicious. The main dish included the ribeye that was caught at happy hour prices with street corn and the bourbon scalloped potatoes. On top of the steak ordering oscar style with a bearnaise sauce and crabmeat and had a side of the chimichurri. Bijan was the server and he was outstanding the owner stopped by several times to talk and make sure the meal was satisfactory and talk about the growth plan of the company and The Business a lively Lively happy hour a great experience and I will definitely be back most of your mouth steak with a nice little sexy swag

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
Came in for date night with my boyfriend, we love Herbs & Rye so we've been itching to come here since the open. We sat at the bar and were taken care of by Adam, such a great bartender and explained the menu very well! We're suckers for trying steak tartare at any restaurant we go to, it's somehow become our thing so we figured might as well start with that. So good! Perfectly balanced, I loved that it came out all ready portioned perfectly and ready to bite and enjoy. We both liked it a lot! Next we shared a NY strip med rare, mashed potatoes and some red wine Demi to go along with it. Steak was cooked perfectly, potatoes were bomb and the Demi was the perfect addition to bring the meal together. Creme br√ªl√©e to finish off the meal, and that too was made just right!

We 10/10 recommend Cleaver to everyone! From service to food and drinks we enjoyed the perfect evening!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
After much thought, this place gets a 5 star review from me.  It was going to be a 4 star review because of the prices but then I had the food and the cocktails and came to my senses.  Now, I didn't come here during happy hour or for a steak (which is a mistake I will not make next time) but I did come here for cocktails and ended up deciding on some delectable appetizers.  

Let's start with the decor.  It is dark.  It has subway tiles.  It is black and white.  It has pictures of celebrities dressed as admirals adorning the walls!  The decor is on point for sure and is quite spacious.  The bartenders are their pros as is customary in Nectaly's joints.  They served me both a sidecar (one of my favorite cocktails, and a porn star martini (one of their featured cocktails).  The sidecar was pretty good, not the best I've had but good.  The porn star martini was awesome and came with a side of bubbles.  As soon as I saw that it had passion fruit in it I had to order it.  You definitely tasted it in the drink and to my surprise, a fresh half passion fruit floated on top.  I've never had passion fruit fresh and let me tell you what, I was almost licking the inside of it it was so good.

When it comes to the food, my last sentence about licking reigns true here as well.  We got the hot wings and the pork belly mac and cheese.  Both were insanely good and something I could easily eat every day of my life if I wanted to die a very young man.  Both are incredibly decadent and flavorful and are both examples of top three wings and mac and cheese that I have ever had, possibly top two!  For a heavenly experience, get both and then drip the excess wing sauce on the mac and cheese.  You will feel like you died and went to heaven.  

I WILL be back for their steaks on happy hour I can assure you that.  This place kicks ass.

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
Food was good but more expensive than Herbs and Rye for, as far as I can tell, no real reason. I did enjoy my peppercorn crust which H&R doesn't offer, though.

Service was really bad, which is a problem I've also had at Herbs on multiple occasions. Makes me wonder if the owner is just too cheap to hire sufficient staff or something

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: 6 of is went here for dinner and it was fantastic. Four of us ordered the XXL ribeye and two of us got the filet. The steaks were perfectly cooked. For sides, the Mac & cheese & risotto were awesome. We weren't huge fans of the brussel sprouts; we expected them to be crispy, but they weren't, and they had too much garlic. I was disappointed that bread & butter costs extra. Although I didn't drink alcoholic, my friends did & the bartender did an excellent job as well. I'd definitely return there during happy hour hours; if you do decide to go, be sure to make a reservation because the restaurant is small and people seem to stay forever (without a care that others are hungry too).

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
Love this place! Amazing flavor on the steak. Great happy hour deals, even on the steak! Waiters were on top of their game. Great service. Dessert was perfect! Had to find room for the Cheesecake and mini donuts. 
Only complaint: too dark to read the menu. Had to use the flashlight on my phone. Also saw a couple other tables doing the same thing.
Other than that...one of the best steakhouses in Vegas!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
Eat here. Top 5 meals we've ever had. No pictures to prove it...gasp. Sorry, we like to live in the moment.

You can tell they're still working out a few kinks since it only opened a month ago, but don't let small hiccups like empty drinks, uncleared plates, or checks ready to be cashed out for too long keep you from having a thoroughly enjoyable evening. We will be back.

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: I love this place!  We went on the grand opening night and cannot say enough good things about it.  The service was amazing and the food was exceptional.  I cannot wait to go back!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
Yay! I have another new favorite steak house! Herbs and Rye had been my long standing favorite but this place is equally awesome and it's on my way home from work! Definitely seems like a larger venue but same great quality vibe. My boss ordered the filet and corn and I of course ordered the ribeye (with a blue cheese rub) and garlic mash. Both steaks came out exactly as ordered. We also ordered brussel sprouts to share. I think its my fault for not realizing we ordered "Street" corn because I didn't realize it is tossed with cotija cheese. We explained to the server that my boss can't eat cheese and I don't eat corn but he was happy to bring out a spinach as substitute. The spinach and Brussels Sprouts were both ok but to be fair I wasn't really interested in them. My steak was amazing and the garlic mashed potatoes were perfect. I would also highly recommend the malbec.
It was easy to make a reservation as well as everyone was extremely friendly. Parking could be an issue although both this restaurant and others in the complex appeared busy and we easily found a parking space.
Can't wait to come back and pretend I'll try somthing else and then order the ribeye!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: Fantastic new steakhouse in Vegas! From bone marrow to foie gras, this place has a ton of on trend dishes in a swanky retro atmosphere. Try the steak tartare. It's out of this world good!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: I loved this spot! Great filet, tuna tartar, Mexican Street corn, and Brussels sprouts. Cocktails were delicious too. Very similar vibe to their other restaurant, Herbs and Rye, but a more spacious bar area. Will definitely come back.

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: Fantastic new steakhouse in Vegas! From bone marrow to foie gras, this place has a ton of on trend dishes in a swanky retro atmosphere. Try the steak tartare. It's out of this world good. The short rib gnocchi was savory and a tad sweet. Oh my yum!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: The menu started out with inside color and temperatures of Steaks Cooked at The Cleaver... This would imply to me that their chief's really concentrate on Steak Temperatures. This was not the circumstance at all!!! #Horrorshow My GF and I ordered a A Filet and and NY strip. Medium PLUS.. The stakes were so bloody and even PURPLE inside we had to spit the steak into our napkins... Steaks were sent back And Both were still under cooked so we just gave up on steaks!!! The Oscar style crab topping was inedible and not fresh at all. Now for the positive the Porn star Martini was excellent... The spicy muscles mushroom, Risotto , grilled  corn and wedge salad was absolutely perfect... I would only eat side dishes apps and drink Cocktails here... Too many steak restaurants in Las Vegas that crush this place! The inconsistency was mind boggling... We like Herb's and Rye and steak temperatures much better but due to Deceiving Cross marketing sign with phone number a reservation was made at Cleaver and NOT Herbs and Rye.. Read Photo Of sign below NOT Herb's and Rye reservation number!! Will go to the better business Bureau on that Bullshit sign!!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: Let me just say the service is amazing for starters. The steak is seriously the most amazing I've had in my life (apart from my dad and fianc√©s steaks) this is by far the most amazing steakhouse! Would definitely come back again! Anniversary and date nights here we come haha!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
I was excited to try Cleaver, since it's from the same folks that opened Herbs & Rye. They All of my expectations for quality and service were met! I ordered the Ribeye, and a side of Cauliflower Au Gratin. The steak was cooked a perfect medium rare, and tasted great. The Cauliflower was also very good, and went well with my steak. Our table ordered a few sides, so I was able to try some of the others. The Bourbon Shallot Potatoes are probably the better potato side dish to order with your steak. The Sweet corn, and the Pancetta Collard Greens are also solid Side dishes. The interior of the restaurant is interesting, but still nice. 

I think it's natural to compare this restaurant with Herbs & Rye. If I had to choose, I would say that Herbs edges Cleaver a little bit, because of price. The happy hours are similar, but if I remember correctly, Herbs gives a free side with a steak order. Cleaver does not. Also, I believe Cleaver is slightly more expensive, in general. Both are great restaurants, so I wouldn't have any problems going back to either one.

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: Great music and vibe right upon walking in. Sat at the bar with Adam, Mike, Gerardo and Jose showed exceptional customer service. This spot is brand new and have nailed it. Food and service make it worth many return visits.  Thanks gents

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
We came here for our anniversary and had a fantastic experience. Love the decor, and the portraits. 

The seafood platter was great, and when we couldn't get the crab shell off the chef did all the work for us. The steaks were tender and cooked to a perfect medium rare. I highly recommend the bourbon peppercorn sauce. And the mushroom risotto was fantastic. A very respectable wine selection, props for having Biale on the list, we're members there. Lastly, the wine director brought us prosecco unprompted at the end of the evening, which was exactly the perfect way to celebrate our anniversary! 

Well done, it's great to see an establishment take pride in their work, and have the staff provide a memorable experience!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
Yum yum yum!!! So happy to have had dinner here.  Came at 5 on a Saturday evening with reservations.  It was not busy.  Easy parking.    But....when we left at 6:30 the parking lot was jam packed and people were waiting for spots.  It shares a parking lot with several other restaurants so be prepared for possible parking difficulties if you come in a weekend after 6.  

Love the vibe...very dark, swanky and romantic, but I felt the music was in conflict with the vibe and was a bit loud. The art was great!

Food was all incredible!  We ordered the steak tartare appetizer and OMG it was awesome. I would go back just for that.  We both got Ribeyes cooked to perfection, and the black garlic butter I added made it that much juicier.  We also tried the mushroom risotto which was excellent, and the street corn, which was so flavorful we couldn't stop eating it. 

The service was top notch...stellar....out of this world!  Our waiters were perfect in every way, and we never had to ask for a thing. I think this was the best water service I've ever had at any restaurant.  They are serious about keeping your glasses full! 

All in all, a perfect evening. Will definitely be back. We are fans of Herbs and Rye so we are happy to have another spot to enjoy.  Happy hour is 5-8 with half price steaks and a few other dishes, and they also have a late night happy hour.

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
Yayyyy so happy this place opened .... I've been going to herbs and rye for years!!!!!!! 

We decided to come here after my friend got off from work she's works right down the street as a bartender .... I was starved and finally persuaded some friends to join lol 

It was around 1:30am when we arrived we greeted quickly and given a table quickly the decor was very nice inside and of course the cool pics they have hanging around!!!! 

Just like herbs and rye happy hour after midnight till close it's still 50 percent off on steaks and a few other items 

I wanted to start with oysters so I was very disappointed when they guy returns and says they are out and have no more :( I guess they didn't buy enough since they are new and trying to get a hang on things don't want to over purchase... so I decided to get the bone marrow instead.... for my main I decided to do filet mignon medium rare .... my friend got the NY strip.... we got the Mac and cheese and the elote corn ... for my drink I did basic vodka soda it's usually all I drink lol 

The bone marrow came out and I was excited I recently started eating this and enjoy it very much..... it has some sweetness from the berries but it was so yummy the berries give it that something special 

Next the steaks.... my filet was cooked perfectly they nicely cut it up for us so we could share..... I loved my steak and my friend loved mine to my friends NY strip was kinda dry though I was a little disappointed but oh well ... the Mac and cheese was good nothing to me super special but the corn I loved it 

If your in the area check this place out there new great happy hour service is great!!!!! They stay open till 3amwhich is amazing

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: Incredible staff, especially Giuseppe. He is a talented courteous man and a great mixologist. Always funny and attentive. Food is impeccable ,menu is impressive. Hands down both restaurants ( herbs and rye) are the best game in town. Rival steakhouses and fish mongers beware. It doesn't get better than this!!!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: Absolutely fabulous!!! Very cool vibe! From the lettuce  wedge salad to the filet with street corn and garlic mashed potatoes as sides. DELICIOUS!!!!! Highly recommend u go here:-)

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: The food and the atmosphere were excellent. Joe was nothing short of amazing as our server, and the wait staff was on point. Came to Cleaver with high expectations and the were met and exceeded! Thank you for reviving hospitality on Paradise

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: This probably the hands down best place I've eaten in Vegas. Everything from the shrimp cocktail to the steaks were amazing. I ordered the shrimp cocktail to begin with and the quality cannot be beat. For my main course I got the ribeye with the Cleaver Spice run, side of brussel sprouts and mashed potatoes and everything was cooked to perfection. Every single guy in my bachelor loved their meal and our waiter provided the best service ive ever gotten in Vegas. The best part is this place is open till 3am and serves great drinks as well. If you want to come here for a bachelor party dinner, ask for Charlie and he'll take care of you.

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
Went here for an amazing steak dinner while we were in Vegas, and we were NOT disappointed!!!

It's in an odd spot, kind of a strip mall, and walk back into a breezeway and there she is!  

Walk in to a very swanky area.  Funny and cool paintings on the walls, romantically lit and excellent ambiance. The waiters were amazing, had great advice on dishes.  

We had an appetizer of bone marrow that was unreal how delicious it was, and a porterhouse for 2!  It was cooked perfectly, flavorful and melted in our mouths!  Absolutely spectacular!

I recommend this place to anyone who is going to Vegas and wants an amazing meal.  It's a bit off the strip, but worth the Uber ride for sure!  Can't wait to go back in April!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
Their happy hour menu is amazing with great cocktails,They are tasty and creative. Their steak is juice and fill of flavor. The best mussels I have ever tasted with load of garlic and the sauce was made to dip with the bread. Atmosphere is welcoming, very large space with private dinning rooms, great for a large group or a romantic dinner. 

A must try and you will fall in love with the place, food, drinks, pricing that fits your pocketbook.

Food In The Plate give it a A+

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
First week open, I had to check this place out. I think their sister property is beautiful and have good steaks so had high expectations of this restaurant.
I'd like to end on a good note so I'll start with the Cons...
We ordered the bone marrow (I paired it with the Scotch, honey, cream cocktail) and both were good. We found it odd that it didn't come with a spoon or a spreading knife to efficiently eat it with.
We then ordered the Squid Ink Pasta, Filet Mignon (Bearnaise sauce and peppercorn) with a side of Pork Belly Mac n Cheese. A big disappointment was that it all got cold fast bc it didn't come out hot in the first place. The Bearnaise sauce was a little too runny.
The server was great but noticed we wouldn't see him for a while. It turned out he was also serving the room by the bar (short staffed so soon?)
Another thing that I noticed was that the menu as much as I liked it, some of the sentences on the Prohibition history seemed to be incomplete.

Pros:
Upon walking in the ambience is beautiful with nice chandeliers, dark lighting, and elegant decor (with a twist of fun).
Blood Orange Oyster shooters were the best I've ever had. Delicious! A must try!
Happy hour is the same as Herbs and Rye which is a great one (half off steaks).
Great history on bartending and cocktails on the menu.

I will try to come back again and hope the best for this place. I really liked the concept and the beautiful ambiance. Here are some pics...

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
An amazing follow up to Herbs & Rye. We ordered half the menu and we'll be back soon to order the other half. The seafood platter was perfect, the oysters were super fresh and the crab legs blew me away. Somehow we managed to polish it off and still have room for the steaks, which were amazing, as expected. I had high expectations and they were exceeded. The whole restaurant is beautiful, the bar staff is fantastic, and the food is on point. I'm writing this review from the forklift they used to roll me out on. Extra points for being thoughtful enough to have one on hand for such purposes.

IMPORTANT: You must try the calamari as an appetizer and do not be intimidated by the number of options you have when it comes to customizing your steak. Order several and mix and match. The foie gras butter and ancho chile lime both deserve a try.

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: I love this spot!  It's my go to restaurant when I want to take friends out OR even eat alone just to treat myself to a good meal.  I haven't found anything on the menu that is not absolutely great.  James is my favorite Head Waiter!  He is so Knowledgeable, Professional and FUN!  My time in Vegas will be ending in December and what I want for Christmas is to take Cleavers with me wherever I go.  LOL.  You have to try this place.  Ask for James!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: This place was hands down amazing. Buddies and I came in for a late night steak. Expectations where crushed and it was delicious.  Charlie our waiter set the bar for customer care. Knowledgeable about all plates and very entertaining yet polite. The best customer service I've ever been a part off.

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: Luckily there was no wait. Service was top notch with super friendly staff. Chopped salad was very tasty  we shared the 60oz Ribeye  which was so tender and flavorful. Street corn was a great side to add. Will definitely go back next time we are in town

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: We loved this place!!  The atmosphere, service and food!!  We both ordered steaks and shared the brussel sprouts and the best au gratin potatoes I have and will ever taste.  Totally worth the trip off the strip!!!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: This place is just AMAZING!! The food, the service quick and prompt, the food...OMG! You won't get disappointed ! I had sea bass with pea& mint risotto ! Yummy!!!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
I'm not familiar with the chain. I visited this restaurant based on the great opening reviews.

The Pork Belly Mac and Cheese was not what I expected. I expected to have the meat mixed into the macaroni not laid on top. The flavors didn't really mix to me as the macaroni was super cheesy and plain however, the Pork Belly was super salty.

The Parmesan Crusted Ribeye came with a Balsamic Sauce across it. The pieces of steak that had the sauce and/or cheese were fantastic! The pieces that didn't were bland. The meat lacked basic seasoning. I wanted salt but didn't want to ask for it as there is non on the table. I'm a basic (salt, pepper, garlic) steak eater. I don't think it takes much to make a good quality piece of meat taste good so, if it's bland to me.... it's bland!

The service was decent. I arrived and was promptly seated. My food arrive quickly. However, once I was done, I sat for awhile waiting for someone to ask if I was finished... maybe they didn't cause 80% of my food is still on the plate. 

4-stars because it wasn't horribly bad... They've only been open for 3 days (but keep in mind that they're a chain) ... if this place was opened longer, I would've given them only 2stars!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
Mmmmmmmm, where do I start? Started with the Mexican firing Squad, fresh, crisp, served in a high ball glass it was gone in seconds.  Then I had the Porn Star it's topped with a piece of passion fruit and it comes with a side of prosecco. It's exactly that, pure passion! Then I opted for an oyster shooter, vodka, tomato-y, sweet, yet smooth, no bite! 

For food, cause a girl's gotta eat and my man was starving, we started with the bone marrow, two large bones seared to perfection served with a berry demi glaze and some micro greens and a type of sliced radish or turnip, it was sticky good, sweet, tart perfection.

Then the main, I had the the Kansas City. It's a 16 oz with bone in. I got it medium, it was pink with seared edges. Lovely and fatty just how I like it. Nate had the filet medium rare, it was perfection. For sides we had the bourbon potatoes and the asparagus. Both were great complements. 

Cleaver is Nectaly's heart and soul come check it out. If you loved Herbs & Rye, Cleaver is the Bees Knees.

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: Came for my sisters bday, the menu wasn't the greatest. The service was awful, took the waiter 30 minutes to get our order and almost an hour for our food. People that arrived afterwards were served first. I won't be going back. Funny how the manager wants to say we check cameras how I don't even have my picture on here, that's awesome! They asked if we wanted water ooooo that's amazing like any other restaurant.

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
Yum. Come during happy hour for half priced steaks.  Not all of them but at least a few
Service was nice. Great location will be back for sure

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: Incredible staff, especially Giuseppe. Always courteous and attentive. Food is impeccable menu is impressive. Hands down best game in town. Rival steakhouses and fish mongers beware! Prices are moderately $$$ expensive

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: I just got a great response back from the manager Nectaly! Note to PUBLIC  I spent over 275.00 in this restaurant eating my side dishes while  the chef got 2 steak temperatures wrong twice... You all should read this managers response and her lack of accountability for how bad my dining experience was... She ridiculed  me for my yelp review!! We all know what YELP is here for if it gets too hot or is not cooked well enough stay out of the kitchen or out of this restaurant!!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: I wanted to love this place bc I'm such a big fan of Herbs & Rye and wanted to support the new sister restaurant but it was a pretty big disappointment. Took my parents here for their anniversary and we were also celebrating my brother's birthday. We ordered the squid ink pasta and mussels which were really good. Also we got the mac & cheese, spinach, and corn as the sides to our 60 oz XXL steak. The bread wasn't as great as it was at Herbs but hey that's ok. The downfall was the steak itself. We were all so excited to dive in to something that massive when it was brought to the table, especially my mom who was telling my siblings (first timers) that Herbs made one of the best steaks she ever ate. Ordered a charred medium rare and got more of a medium well. I thought it was the lighting but it wasn't juicy so I told our server. He took it back to the kitchen and confirmed with us that it was over cooked so they were going to remake us another one which was fine. But after 10 min with sides on the table getting cold and hungry levels going down, the steak when it was brought out wasn't as appetizing anymore. We were pretty over it at that point and probably only ate less than a quarter of the steak between the five of us. I understand that mistakes are made in the kitchen bc I work in the same industry here in Vegas as well. But the experience overall just sucked. We were asked if we wanted dessert. We got a creme br√ªl√©e. It was brought out with no happy birthday or happy anniversary. I'm sure it wasn't a big deal for the celebrants but it would've been nice to feel somewhat special. I'm not sure why the hostess, when making a reservation, even asked if you're celebrating anything special if nothing extra is being done. Not even a free dessert at the very least for the experience we had. As much as I wanted to love this place there was nothing done by the server or manager at the very end to give us hope again. I get we came here for happy hour prices but even with that it wasn't worth it. In the end it just sucks getting the disappointed faces from my parents who came to celebrate a really special day for them and saying we should've gone somewhere else. I really hope they fix things here because we will not be returning or recommending this place otherwise.

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: The Steak Was Great. Cooked perfect with a charred outer. The bartenders are great too. Our cocktails were made perfect. Deft recommend this place is you want a great meal in a cool atmosphere out of those cramped up casinos.

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: Related to Herbs&Rye, Cleaver is its bigger brother.  Everything from the service,  food and decor were fantastic! We had a happy hour steak and porkchop with Mac n cheese and broccolini.  The bacon is to die for.  Completed with the best creme brulee I've ever had,  I highly recommend you eat here! Michelle,  our server was very attentive! Thanks for a great evening!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: Awesome spot! Grand Opening night and seems to be doing great! I'm not surprised, owned by an honorable man; whom hired respectable people! The food is always phenomenal! The environment is very relaxed and subtle but still has a sweet energetic vibe too! SWEET PLACE! Leo and I are very excited to add another amazing place to grab late night food and drinks along with Herbs & Rye!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: Surprisingly at 11:00 pm there aren't a lot of options in Vegas for dinner other than fast food for a group of 8.  We found Cleaver on Yelp and WOW could not have been happier.  The vibe is beyond perfect, the music incredible and the food nothing short of amazing!  Our server James was upbeat, fun and made our dining experience even more memorable.  Music on Wednesday night when we visited was a hip hop sample of Quincy Jones accomplishments - AMAZING!  We loved Cleaver and have already started to spread the word for those visiting Vegas.  Highly recommend the pork belly mac & cheese and the pork chop...I'll be back!!!!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
Best dang food... great hot bartender too! 
 The calamari,  the Carpaccio and the steaks!!!! Freaking amazing!!!!

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text:
Delicious. Came by and had a ribeye to split(parm and balsamic crust), bread, street corn, garlic mash and donuts for dessert. Everything was great! But we also had a couple cocktails which we both loved and do then we forgot our card in the restaurant. Since we had to come back the next day to retrieve it we ate there again. I mean don't want to be rude right?

This time we had the ribeye with cleaver rub and an egg on top, bone marrow, asparagus and pickled eggs, and some more cocktails. Great again! 

Egg was probably the best steak topping. It was a freaking good egg. But probably parm and balsamic was the better crust. Bone marrow was a fun thing to try because we never had it, it was great but it's a small starter. Bramble was the best cocktail. Street corn was probably the best side. It's hard to pick best tho everything was really good.

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: Awesome!! I was expecting it to be great as I have never been disappointed with herbs and rye but it was above and beyond my expectations.

name: Cleaver -  Butchered Meats, Seafood & Cocktails
text: I had the 9 ounce filet mignon, and the collard greens for my side. The friends I ate with ordered the cauliflower, bourbon mashed potatoes, and the corn. There was enough of the sides to share among all of us. My filet mignon was great! No complaints about any of the sides, either. Our waiter was knowledgeable. My water glass was low for maybe five seconds before it was refilled.  The R and B that was playing was great as well. My only complaint was that the music was too loud. Conversation was difficult.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
I just finally got a chance to shop at this place for the first time since it opened. There are two reasons I didn't give this place a full five stars. One of the reasons is that it's a little bit pricier than Seafood City or Ranch 99 in the middle of town. The other reason is that it is smaller than Seafood City or Ranch 99.

One of the things that I love about this place is that it's on the Southeast side of town closer to where I live. This place is great for people who live in Henderson because we finally have a fairly large Market to shop at 4 Asian and Filipino foods. This place is just a little bit pricier than Seafood City but if you live in Henderson and don't feel like driving to the middle of town then this is a great place to go. It's also a little bit smaller but they seem to carry all of the basics.

The restaurant that they have inside is also really good. Because of the amount of traffic that seems to go through there the food seems to always be fairly fresh. I tried the Sisig, beef steak and BBQ Chicken skewer. The food was great. Although the Sisig was made a bit differently than what I'm used to it was still very good and full of flavor. I would definitely go back to try other dishes.

The one thing I was really surprised with the huge selection of ice cream. So many different flavors of ice cream like mango, Ube, Green Tea and Coconut. Next time I go I'm getting the Halo Halo ice cream.

To summarize if you live anywhere near Silverado Ranch and Bermuda you definitely need to check this place out, even if it's just to eat Filipino food in the restaurant.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: 5/26/17 around 10:00 am. Medyo mahal mga tinda nila compare mo sa ibang asian grocery store. Customer service is terrible. At the cashier lane, very long line with 1 cashier only. Seems like she doesn't care. She's didn't bother to tell us if another cashier is on the way or call a manager for help.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: The cafeteria here provides some of the most delicious food in Las Vegas. No, it's not regal and it's not even a mom and pop restaurant. The cafeteria inside this market is just that. What makes it amazing is the fresh ingredients and the wide selection of yummy Asian treats they offer. In addition, the secret is out and lots of people come here during lunch hours. They have a full time cook grilling chicken, pork, and beef kabobs. I almost forgot to mention the delicious grilled stuffed squid. It's all scrumptious. You will not be disappointed.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Great Filipino market. Staff are friendly, great products as well as to go food. Most importantly it's close to my house. Highly recommend.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
The check out service at this place is the slowest and most inefficient I've ever seen! Their register counters are so short that you barely have any room to put your things and the end tail of it also didn't have enough room. If people decided to buy a ton of things, the cashier would need to keep walking around the counter to put the bags in the customers cart! 

The place is no seafood city but it's a good neighborhood market to buy meats, fishes, and groceries. Mostly Filipino brands but there are others mixed in there too like Japanese and Chinese. 

Some of the veggies don't look fresh anymore. 

Also, random observation ... The workers are dressed in regular clothes (some even looked like they were about to hangout with their friends) so they almost look like they're just shopping and being nice that's why they're restocking the wall. Other places make you wear a uniform or at least an apron or a name tag or something where you can clearly distinguish that they work there in case you have to ask a question. They have to remember, not all their consumers are filipino. They need to able to easily find someone they can ask.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
Not the best selection for produce. Have bought bad bananas twice now. But did get good mangoes and young coconut. But overall, it has what I need and a few more. 

I am thrilled about  fast food Filipino eatery attached! And I have eaten there twice and liked it.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
The staff of this establishment have always been so friendly and we never had any issues when going to this location at Silverado Ranch. Every time we need assistance the staff is very helpful. The staff always direct us to the appropriate aisle and as for their laughter, it seems like they are enjoying their work, which should be a goal for any business establishment.

I do not believe that any of the staff gives any sort of attitude when we are grocery shopping. I always see and hear every staff member being overly helpful. I would rather have staff in an establishment that is helpful compared to staff that just does not really care and shrug off customers. 

The food is also very tasty and are of good quality. As for taste, not everyone is prepared for how Filipino cuisines unique blend of island flavor and taste and it is up to other customer's if they can handle the unique blend of taste and flavor of Filipino cuisine. 

Overall our experience has been very positive and we would return again and again because of the wonderful customer service that we receive.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: I'm happy to have found this new Filipino grocery store so I do not have to drive all the way to Seafood City in traffic. The prices here are reasonable and the cafeteria style diner is excellent. They have a good selection of everything that SFC offers and caters to those who live on the south/southeast side for town.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Went here with my family for dinner there were a lot of flies but sometimes that can't be helped. What really bothered us was when a man had dropped his canned Thai tea it splashed all over us and our table. It took 20 minutes for someone to come and clean it up. But we tried not to let that get us down and decided to get dessert, we get the cassava cake but it was molded and expiration date is July 2, 2018! Today's date is July 27th! I think it's crazy that no one noticed that the cassava cake was covered in mold. I'm not satisfied I wouldn't recommend coming here

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
Poor customer service every time I come here. Rude cashiers. Sometimes I encounter a helpful stock person. The workers at the food place are fairly nice. I only come here out of desperation. Produce quality is so-so. They're the kind that you'd have to use right away or at least within a day or two tops. I've never had anything from their meat section.  Their shelves and fridge area seem to have a mish mash of everything, but at the same time, nothing at all. Be careful when grabbing any of their sweets at the shelves by the cash registers. I bought a cassava cake that was dated sell by 9/28 and 9/30 but already had mold on it (two to be exact). 

I really try my best not to come back.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
I am a "Seafoodie" and a "Freshfoodie". This is pretty much a higher end Asian seafood and meat market with a grill serving up items you would never find as the usual buffet.

Whole fish. All Kinds. Pork Belly. Love this place!

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
I don't know how this place hasn't received a visit from SNHD...

-Their produce quality is . They seem to keep their produce past their shelf life as in, green veggies are more brown than they are green and are still on the shelves to be purchased.

-Their "fresh" seafood section is not appealing (compared to seafood city HENDERSON).

-I went to IP on 9/25 to check out their blue crab and this isn't the first time, but the blue crabs were just in a brown box. probably the box it shipped in, i have no clue.  It was not refrigerated, not kept on ice, in water, nothing. Just take a group of blue crabs and put it in a box and thats what you'll see.  During this visit, about 90% of the crabs were dead with legs broken off.  A couple even had smashed shells.  Now I'm no expert but I highly doubt dead crabs should be kept with live crabs...to top it off the little "water" or whatever it was at the bottom of the box was brown...

-I went back to IP 9/26 to pick up a packet of spice i needed and decided to check if they got a new shipment of blue crabs...NOPE! They sure didn't!  The SAME box that was there the day before was still there. Dead crabs, smashed crabs, same.

-Their "fresh fish" section isn't properly iced entirely as ive seen at other asian stores and does not look like it's being kept at its required temperatures.

-Plus side, I haven't encountered any rude staff members.  Cashiers are always nice, staff at the restaurant are always nice. 

Plain & simple, unless you're shopping for packaged items like snacks, spices, etc. or stuff from the freezer, I suggest going elsewhere for fresh produce/seafoods/meats.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
WARNING-Do NOT expect help or service of you are white. I was completely ignored by two employees and waved off by another. I was told afterward by a friend that that is to be expected if you are white. They won't be going out of their way to help you.

Shame because I wanted a place to recommend that wasn't one of the normal places around here. STAY AWAY! If the money from this veteran isn't good enough for them, will yours?

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
I'd love to go to this place very near to my place,breakfast is so cheap and delicious.
I hope they will improved more like the fish section and meat,I was disappointed seeing how they prep the fish on display ,seems like they don't have procedures on the proper handling of thawed fish,I saw this guy adding ice  he removed the salmon fish heads on display I thought he will removed it or changed the fish on display but he put it back on his cart with water from thawed Salmon heads in plastic  so the poor fish heads for display is like swimming on the water at the cart I was watching him doing it,thinking he would change the fish on display ,he added more ice and returned the fish heads on display  I was standing next to him . I hope u must follow proper handling g of fish consider temperature,and contamination issues...this is our Filipino market we should be proud and make sure you follow proper sanitary guidelines to avoid contamination and maintain highest standard at all times.your meat labels says Mexico,USA ,Canada why not specific?wild or farmed fish ,origin?

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
I'm so done with this place!!!!!!! Why are they still open with all the rotten produce they are selling? Management should be ashamed of themselves for allowing this to be sold in their store.  

I unfortunately stopped in to get Filipino hot dogs and this is conveniently located nearby. My bf texted me while I was in the store that he also needed onions. I noticed that the yellow and red onions were pretty much rotten and flies were near. The white onions were the only decent ones so that's what I had to settle for. So when I went to pay, the cashiers are so painfully slow and kept stopping to talk to each other. And the cashier that I had was so f****ng rude. She just threw my things in a bag and all my items were being slammed against each other. Why the hell do you work at a grocery store if you're going to be so damn rude?! 

Get it together Island Pacific! I will avoid this place from now on

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
I come here when I get a nostalgic for home and family. Good selection of Filipino/Asian ingredients and foodstuffs. They fry fish to order and have hot food offerings as well. 

SO HAPPY it's just across the street too!

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
Looking to broaden my horizons with more amazing food experiences, I decided to check out this Flippino market. After having an amazing lunch next door at the Lucky Thai, experimentation and intrigue grasped my interest at all of the sorts of wonderful foods they sell inside. Only slightly educated about the Philippines eating styles such as the rice infusion with most dishes the amazing spices that are used make their food choices. They practice a more healthier diet than Americans. The fusion of all their spices is so electric with all that zing when the fork goes into your mouth and touches your tongue it's a celebration of the marriage of all those spices. 

This market is very well organized that has very friendly staff. I was so impressed with the level of effort put out by the staff to help the guest here. They will help you out to the car and even load your groceries, for free. One will not see this at the large stores such as Kroger or Walmart. Not even Whole Foods does this for their customers.

While I was meandering around I visited the fruits and veggie section and discovered something new called Jackfruit. I did buy some of the Jackfruit in the rough and some already cut up. After consulting Google for what this fruit is and it's properties I took the leap and tried it. It is so good and tasted fantastic in a fruit salad that I made at home. I found coconut and mangos here as well that were perfect. The new coconut milk that I bought was very delicious with a pleasant taste too. 

During the check out process this went very smooth with the cashier smiling at me. I do not understand their native tongue but the cashier was having a conversation as I checked out with the cashier next to her. It seemed friendly and he seemed to be in a position of authority at the store. Even though I did not speak their language I understood what I the price was. They accept credit cards and cash here as well. After paying I left and was off to sample new treats.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Decent size compared to other nearby Asian markets, so I'm great full to have it nearby. But it's still really lacking in selection compared to the larger stores in china town, it's also more expensive.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
Two stars only for such poor customer service from an older lady who works the cash register. She was so mean to my little girl. I won't even go into details about the incident. 
I found this place on Yelp since I was around the area. Needless to say, I won't be returning.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
It is pleasant to have an Asian Pacific market in the area. Even though the place is not finalized yet, it has most of the amenities that are important for Asian and  southeastAsian cuisines. The place is still missing certain things, such as basil. 

Beyond that the food court is certainly popular and provides hot foods for a reasonable price.  Granted the tables are old and rickety, but judging a place for its furniture and not the service it provides is shallow. Finally, to address the issue that the employees do not speak English, the market is a Filipino market,  it would be great if they spoke English, but the market's primary target market are not necessarily English speakers just as Albertsons primary market speaks English and doesn't necessarily speak other languages. 

If the place polishes itself up over time,  organizes itself a little better, and provides the last missing components of southeast Asian cuisine, then this place will have met the needs of those looking for a market of southeast Asian cuisine.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: I was so excited to try this market but had a bad experience with a mean cashier. First I ordered some food and that went smoothly and the BBQ chicken was so good. Then I decided to get a couple grocery items, thats when I had to deal with Kim. She was unhelpful tried to charge me the wrong price for my mamon. The product would not scan so she just put in her own price that was much more then what it should have been. When I told her that is incorrect she got upset and said well I guess I have to fix it for you??? Rudest customer service I have ever had in our neighborhood. VERY DISAPPOINTED

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: I love to eat here nice customer service, good food, large portion low priced. Come here and see for yourself. I've to other Filipino restaurants and the food is not as good in comparison. Breakfast is great large portions for less price. Great variety to choose from. Fresh cooked from the grill. I recommend this place to all my friends not just my Filipino friends either.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
Finally, an Asian grocery store close by!! Only thing is, it's not that great. Let me explain why. 

Before, we would drive the 20+ minutes to Seafood City to buy the Asian necessities not found at regular grocery stores. Here at Island Pacific, I can still buy most of the Asian items I need, that are SEALED. Things like a 25 lb bag of jasmine rice, soy sauce, spices, chips, you get where I'm going. These things I know are sealed and have a longer shelf life. 

The meat and vegetables on the other hand, are pretty sketch. On numerous visits, majority of the produce was sad. All of it looked old and was wilted. The ginger even had flies around it. If that's how they keep their vegetables, I can only imagine what their meat is like. No thanks!! 

Other cons I have about this place.. The aisles are tiny!! I know us Asians are small people, but come on. And if a worker is stocking a shelf with their inventory in the aisle, good luck trying to get in. And one last thing, who the hell designed this place???? The cash registers block the entrance to the actual store so I'm forced to enter through this tiny gap or walk all the way around toward the restaurant to actually get inside. And it doesn't help that customers are inconsiderate and have no sense of direction or space. Don't get me started on the cashiers. They are slow and not that friendly. I've only had one cashier that was friendly and quick. I wish I remembered his name, but good job to you, guy!! 

They do offer a rewards card, so you're able to save a bit of $ if you join. There is also a tiny Goldilocks to get your baked goods and a restaurant (Philhouse) to enjoy some grub. 

Will I continue to shop here? Yes because rice goes quick at our house. But I'll still drive further to get the rest of my Asian produce.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: The only reason why this place gets one star is because it was really organized and clean. My mom bought some of there meat and there was some discoloration of the meat and the meat had a god awful smell to it. I ended up getting sick from the meat. Never buying meat here.. a little disappointed because it was my first time

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Very good selection of Filipino and Asian food.Its A beautiful store and very clean and convenient.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
From the outside it looks like such a nice market place and initial thought coming in is it's like any typical Asian market place. Most products appear to look as if it's from the Philippines but I noticed that their products are not fresh looking. Things look old and I have witnessed some mold-looking things in bakery items. I wanted to come in to purchase meat and veggies but changed my mind after viewing some of these products. I feel like this place has so much potential to be a great and convenient market place, maybe it's because their workers are adjusting but they should definitely pay attention to fresh food rotation. 

I plan to come in again at a later time and hopefully update my review.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
Late review. I was there on Saturday. This is my second time here, first time here I went to food court only. There were 2 check out counter, 1 cashier was busy checking out a customer so I went to the other one with a male cashier. No customer in front of him and he was just scribbling, I unloaded my groceries from shopping cart, he didn't make eye contact, greet me or acknowledge me and before I finished unloading he walked away. Once I finished, I looked around and saw him on produce section talking to a customer. I did not wait for another minute, I walked away and left everything. That was the worst customer service I ever experienced, I never felt so invisible.

Will I go back to shop there? I don't think so. There are other Asian stores in the area, so I have options where I want to spend my money at. 

I will be back to food court only, their food is decent and people behind the counter are helpful and friendly.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Cool, easy, in and out. I come in and I go out! Happy I don't have to drive alllllll the way to Chinatown for a can of coconut milk! Fresh shrimp! I like it!

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: A lot of choices to choose from as far as meat and vegetables selections.  They have some   quarter to half the size of the seafood city fish selections. It's smaller than seafood city but better. People that works there are friendlier. Mist check this place out.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Nice clean place new business in the neighborhood not fresh fish screen is not smelly place is that kind of place you can buy a fish and making him fry for you prices in a few things over price a bit everybody friendly know that I was hungry but I just wish for the business they offer free samples

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: So glad to finally have an Asian supermarket on the east side. Place is very clean and staff is friendly. They also serve Filipino cooked dishes to go. Just really glad don't have to go into town when I have Filipino cravings.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
This place is great - it has lots of products you won't find in a regular grocery store.  It's laid out so you can find everything you need quickly and easily.  Aisles are clean and the fish/meat department look spic and span with a wide selection.

I was able to find everything I needed to make Tom Kha Gai and Prik Nam Pla.  It's almost impossible to find fresh lemongrass anywhere else - but they had plenty!  The Thai chili peppers were super fresh and right on point.

I had perfect service from the employees - albeit I had to wait for just a bit because there was only one register accepting credit cards the night I was there.

Oh, and if you like coconut milk - they have the biggest selection I've ever seen.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
This market is great! It is a filipino based market and prices are pretty good. Produce is hit and miss as they may leave old stock on shelves. Meat department is ok. Fresh fish bin is ok but be careful of improper refrigeration of fish and shrimp. The restaurant has great food. My only gripe is that there is one supermarket register clerk that is grouchy and looks like she is disgusted being there. No smile and no acknowledgment toward customers. Will definitely continue to be a regular shopper here but will do my best to avoid Mrs Grouchy.

By the way, if you are 100% filipino and if you don't speak filipino in anyway or weren't born in the Philippines, you will get the cold shoulder.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
Awesome place.
Cheap prices.
We like
To shop their from time to time. The place
Is always clean. The fruit is the best in town. Will keep coming back.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: A cute small little store. Just fast and easy! I like that i dont have to drive to chinatown .

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Finally an Asian food market that's close by! Love it! Clean since it's still new. Workers are nice and they sell filipino food too!!!

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
Horrible service, rude cashiers. High pricing for what they offer. I shopped through the produce section and most of the food there was old, dried out or welted already. 

The BBQ place had me waiting for more then 10 minutes to even get help and then decided to have a conversation with one of their friends that arrived after me. I decided to just leave and not continue waiting. I tried to go to Goldilocks instead in hopes of just ordering a drink. I asked the cashier for what I wanted and she decided to ignore and walk away from me. I asked her again if I could get my drink and she sits at the register and says nothing..
SERIOUSLY WHAT IS UP WITH THE SERVICE IN THIS WHOLE MARKET.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: i give 5  because its close to my place very convenient im there all the time for breakfast! food are always good and the area where u eat is very clean! i just wish you can extend the breakfast til 11am PLEASE

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
We came in here on NYE, and it was super busy! I am not a fan of crowds, but I just followed my husband as he made his way through the store. 

First thing that I noticed is that they had meats cooking right inside the door. People were lined up to purchase this. All over the store there were small tables set up with either samples, or freshly prepared food to purchase. Towards the back there was a very large fresh fish section. Whole fish were on top of the ice here. I didn't want to look too hard, since I was afraid that I would see one of them move! That is how fresh they looked. 

I had come in for some oyster sauce, but also found fresh mushroom, green onion and other ingredients that I needed. Their produce section was packed with fresh items. The prices were very reasonable as well.

We got in line for our purchases, and our cashier and bagger were so efficient that as soon as the person ahead of us was done paying, our order had already been bagged and rung up. They were not messing around! FAST!!!

I am uncertain if it is always as busy as it was the day we went, but everyone seemed very organized. The food was fresh and everything was fully stocked. It was a fun experience.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Super disappointed. I went in today to get ingredients to make pinakbet for my family for dinner. I had my pork and everything else going in the pot, and had bought the vegetables that were pre packed together. After throwing half of the vegetables in my pot, I reached for the eggplant. That's when I saw mold on the opposite end! So gross!! I had to dump my whole pot of food and let it go to waste because all the vegetables were sealed together and most of the vegetables were touching each other! This is such a disgrace!

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: If I could give NO stars at all, worst customer service ever!!!! Just because we don't speak Filipino, no assistance at all. I had to raise my voice to get their attention.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: We bought some crawfish here one day and they were horrible we tossed them out. They were super cheap so no biggie we weren't expecting much. Produce section has a nice variety so I've been back a couple times. THE OTHER DAY I went back I saw dies buzzing around the fish and the shrimp was laying out in a bin and the ice underneath was completely melted. I Highly doubt they were being stored at the right temp. So I don't think I'll be back.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
Oh wow, I lived in the Philippines growing up so going here always feels like home! They have everything you need! Great meat in the butcher shop, awesome fruits that I don't usually find in normal supermarkets, and throwback goodies like C2 iced tea and Filipino snacks!

My favorite thing about this place would be their food section. All Filipino food and it's so so cheap for a good meal! I pay 8 dollars for the BBQ on stick meal with rice and I can share that with a friend! The tilapia is also big and yummy! Sinigang and other soupy/stew meals are AMAZING! I always come here when I'm hungry and it definitely satisfies without breaking the bank! 

This is my go to place, I like it better than seafood city because it's more easy going and chill. Not too much going on and it's not too cramped! :)

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: I tried to go in again for another chance...still have bad moldy veggies.  My hubby wanted fried fish and while the guy was waiting for it to be done frying, he was cleaning something, wearing gloves...he went to check on the fish, holding it up WITH THE SAME GLOVES ON! YUCK! I left out of there so quick!

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Nice to have an Asian/Pacific Island store close to Henderson. There's a small mom and pop shop not too far from here,Kainan Market, that I usually‚Äã go to for my grocery and hot Filipino food to-go, but it's good that a supermarket with a meat counter is available in this area. The store is very clean and well organized. It used to be a Fresh N Easy, so it's not huge and not small. All the workers are really nice and very efficient. There was a Goldilocks Bakery that is now open and full of yummy pastries and cakes. Plenty of fresh mangos and whole Jackfruit too! I love unique fruits and it's cool to see them not in a can. There's a fast food restaurant in there as well that sells pork crackling, Filipino food, and bbq. I didn't get to try the restaurant, but next time I will. There is even a little stand where you can buy quick snacks to go like sticky rice balls and even Balut! Authentic! The workers were really helpful in answering my questions about some unfamiliar desserts and everyone just seen to be happy working there. I bought some pork belly and beef short ribs  which are hard to find at my local grocer so I was very pleased not to have to drive down to Spring Mountain for 2 items. The meat counter was clean and the meat was fresh. Prices are very reasonable. They also have a wide selection of frozen goods which I but lots of next time. From frozen shu mai ( Chinese dumplings ) to lumpias ( Filipino style egg rolls ). Is fresh better? Of course, but I can't make them and these are pretty good and convenient lol. Give this place a try if you like to expand your cooking pantry and grab some quick bites while your there. You just might like it!

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
*The fresh fish appeared well cared for, well iced, clear eyes, etc.
*A caution sign was prominently displayed about handling fresh fish, but there were no gloves or even hand sanitizer seen.
*Fresh fish are whole, but apparently may be taken to counter for cleaning (don't know if scaling, fillet, etc. are offered.) 
*Was a little dismayed to see a large mound of scrimp piled on top of ice (unrefrigerated, in public access) as the top ones were room temperature 
*nice selection of products, from produce to meat.
*predominantly Philippine products  
*convenient location (if you're in the area)
*nice selection at restaurant 
*don't expect to find any organics, not even rice

We picked up a few frozen seafood items and a couple staple items (fish sauce, etc). We'll likely return to explore some of the fresh fish.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: I mean really.... Been to this place when they first opened awhile back. Wasn't impressed then & recently just went again & STILL not impressed.  Workers DO NOT greet you at all from the time you walk through those doors AND out.  Really... not even at check-out guys??? Not a single word. C'mon. I'm embarrassed to even say that the some workers are of my kind. And I hate that I even have to say that.  I have to literally force my parents not to come to this store because of how horrible it is.  If I have to stoop to that for my parents sake, I don't know what else to tell you guys.  Fresh produce be rotting.  (Probably as long as the first time I been here). The fresh meats seem ok, I guess.  But who knows how fresh they really are.  I wouldn't chance it.  I got lucky & found a bag of decent onions my mom asked me to get (the only reason why I stepped into this place because I was nearby).  I don't understand how they are even still open honestly.  Don't bother coming here if you're looking for fresh produce for real tho.  Unless you're willing to spend big bucks on expensive rotten food... that's all up to you!!!

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: If you don't want to go to Chinatown then this is the placr. However, I did see some flies flying around so it freaked me out cause the fish is sitting out over ice so the flies probably landed on it.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: This place Is a hit or miss with fresh seafood . Like that they have a wide selection of fish .

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: I bought salmon here yesterday that according to the date, should have been good for another week.  The salmon stank so bad and when I opened it, was clearly rotten. This was my second time shopping here, will not return.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: I'm so happy that Island Pacific Seafood Market just opened up... Don't really have to drive too far to go to a Filipino market. Location is perfect, it took over the old Fresh and Easy space on Silverado and Bermuda.  Prices are kinda high but oh well... Just glad that it's open and close to home .... Everyone is so friendly... I was greeted at least 7 times.... My new Filipino go to place....

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
"5 stars. Woohoo! As good as it gets!"

So I was picking up my to-go order today from Teppan Bento when I noticed this place. A real fish market in the old Fresh & Easy store! My take-out was calling to me but I just had to run into Island Pacific & tease myself for a minute or two. I didn't have time to shop but I did take a few photos. Everything looked wonderful, fully stocked, very clean. So how can I rate a store where I haven't bought a thing? I've lived in these parts for 6 years & we've had nothing like this. Yup, you open a place like this near me & I'll give you 5 stars!!

Don't worry, I'll go back soon & confirm that my 5 star rating is deserved.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: dissapointing meal in my life. It was like the kings underware. The food was not only inedible but fraudulent. Service as stated were totally unrecognizable. but never was able to get anyone of any accountability.deserves 0 star worst don't go if you want to stay healthy

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Excellent assortment of Asian foods. Prices are fair and comparable to other Filipino markets. They have a food court with a good variety of options if you don't feel like cooking. Location is good with a good amount of parking.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
I have had a wonderful experience with this establishment every time that I go grocery shopping. I want to give a 5 star rating to one of your employees, I think her name is Sol Matematico. She always serves with a smile and very informative of the information that is needed when it comes to sending balikbayan boxes. She is always helpful and always shows courtesy and patience. I also like the fact that she is always cheerful, smiling, and very informative. 

For me, if I had my own establishment and I had an employee like Sol Matematico I would be very blessed because she is very customer oriented and friendly.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
2.5 stars rounding up. It's interesting for me to rate a supermarket but  I guess there's a first for everything.

I live around Silverado Ranch area and was in dire need of noodles. I came across this market seeing it was new and the closest to me, no more than a 5minute drive. I wasn't feeling well and figured the some of the Asian noodles (Chinese or Japanese) I've typically bought before would be available and be on my way.

I stepped in and boy was it small. I believe there were 5 aisles at most. I made my way (downtown walkin' fast faces past and I'm home bound dun dun dun dun) over to the noodle aisle and like some of the reviews had mention, a lot of it were Filipino products, not a bad thing just something I'm unfamiliar with so it was difficult finding something I've previously eaten in the past. I was able to find a Japanese product (a=singular=one lol) and purchased that, Less than $4-$5 and on my way I went. 

I'd come here for convenience but just a heads up they may be limited with their inventory

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: I've been passing by this place for months now. Today, I've decided to come in for some fish sauce and noodles, i was surprise and impress with the store. It has wide selections of oriental foods selection without having to drive to China town. The seafoods on ice seem very fresh. The store also has a cafeteria type of Filipino foods. You can eat there or take to go and they are very busy. Services are good. I would visit this market again.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: The supermarket was close to my house, I didn't want to drive 20 min. Most of the produce are old and wilted. And the meat are a bit pricey, but that's what I get for not driving far.  Its has some of the stuff I need and they fry the fish. 3 would be a fair rating.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
Love coming here for Asian groceries, certain produce or fruits that you won't find in regular grocery stores. There's a small deli for good delicious Filipino food and you can eat here too! 

You can find fresh seafood and fresh meat which isn't too pricey. 

Very convenient for me since it's right down the street.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: I have a complain about the Asian fat young lady at the food to go section...everytime i go there she is always rude no respect to oldest...then finally one morning I went down there to get a breakfast to go..and guess what???she was there ..so I say fine..so I start ordering...so while I'm odering...she keep saying ....hah..hah...like she don't understand me...and I keep repeating my order to her...and keep saying..ha.ha???.so finally I start raising my voice coz it's seem like she is deaf...and tired of repeating my order.so she turn around and guess what???the reason why she can't hear me???.she was wearing a  earphone..listening to her music...i was so shock...like wtf....she is so rude....after that incident..i say to myself...as long as she work there..never gonna go there no more...they have the best food....the best stuff too except that person...sorry he ruining it for everbody

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Smelled horrible when walking in. I bought Tuna steaks and it was really fishy and not edible. It was supposed to be sushi grade quality per the packaging and it was not. Produce was ok so long as you needed to use it in the next few days. Went to the cafeteria area and bought lumpia, it was pretty good but a little over cooked

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
Sad to say I like this place more than a mom and pop local store but, I do. 

There's more selection of produce and groceries. Even a deli section for your meats, or should I say "Asian" meats -- oxtail, marinated short ribs.

It's closer to home than Greenland or Seafood City. 

Plus there's a "food court" in there with all your Filipino goodness ready made food needs.

Always get the VIP card if you can cuz that stuff adds up in the end! 
,

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
Horrible customer service. Love to
Lie.  
Said food was already sold and then once we bought the food that was there they put out the new one which they had already told us that it was sold.  We were paying cash and they refused to sell us the good fresh one and wanted to get rid of the old looking food first.  We understand if they told
Us old food had to go first but not with the stupid lying the employees are allowed to make.  
Almost the exact thing happen the previous day.  
Really need to all go in customer service training if it keeps happening.  
Would rather go to Maryland for now till they get better. Or even Joshan.  Reliable marketplaces.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: I maybe biased but as a Filipino family; we love this place. It's not the biggest Asian supermarket but it has everything we need. From tocino to pork blood to pancit bihon to bangus; etc; this place has everything we need. Don't get me wrong, we've been to Seafood City which is much bigger but way more crowded. We come here since it's close to the crib and the prices aren't terrible. The meat prices are good compared to Walmart and other supermarket chains. The price for a 50 lbs bag of rice is also very reasonable. We have had no problems with service in this store. I've seen white folks in this store too and they seemed to have no issues shopping here as well. I haven't tried the restaurant inside the store but I'll give it a shot sometime soon. Come by and support.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: I'm not picky or ever put up reviews but the fish I bought was so gross and spoil , end it up throwing a way . Don't even bother going there .

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text:
This place is closed to my house. It's convenient, my concern is that every time we come here. They never have enough cashier. Please management can you open up all 3 registers at all time. 
Thank you!!

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: FINALLY an ASIAN market nearby! Don't have to go all the way to Chinatown. Has pretty much everything you'll need. Even has a fast food place as well inside, with all the specialties of Filipino cuisine. Definitely will be the market to go to for asian  items.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Smelled horrible when walking in. I bought Tuna steaks and when I got it home it was really fishy and not edible. It was supposed to be sushi grade quality per the packaging and it was not. Produce was ok so long as you needed to use it in the next few days. Went to the cafeteria area and bought lumpia, it was pretty good but a little over cooked. Don't reccomend going there. I definitely will not be back

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Cafeteria has good and tasty filipino. Portion of the food are huge.  Service staffs are great!  Price is reasonable.  I ordered to go and they even, saran wrap it for you to make sure the food won't spill.  I will surely come back here for more and I highly recommend this place.   I hope they continue what they ate doing.  Thank you!

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Great market. I usually go for the Filipino snacks, which they have plenty of. Decent sized produce department, good size meat department, and a hot food counter with all the classics. Big bonus: Goldilocks inside as well. Basically, it's a smaller, much cleaner version of Seafood City. They carry all the produce I need, but I really love that they have fresh packaged produce for popular Filipino dishes like Sinigang and Pinakbet. It's perfect for someone like me who only cooks for 1-2 people, saves money and no wasted veggies.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: Its so close to home. Everything is organized and clean. I can run in, grab what i need, and get out. There's never any lines when i come and i usually spend less than 10 minutes in the store.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: The staff are very helpful with everything you need. Everything is close to everything you need in there. If you're there for lunch at philhouse, there's a shelf nearby with all desserts and delicacies. The staff are very knowledgeable with anything you need with whatever ingredients for a great family meal.

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: I'm not picky or ever put up reviews but the fish I bought was so gross and old . Don't even bother going there .

name: Island Pacific Seafood Market
text: This Market is the most terrible i ever had. i bought chicken wings,thigh and 3pcs fish last night. i cook it for our dinner but the damn thing is the chicken are so gross! and the fish are really frozen. and the scariest thing i bought some ginataang bilo and its so much watery and the kare kare is so tasteless. and i ask some shrimp paste and they gave me a very sour shrimp paste. and someone gave me a newone and they bothblaughing at me.
